entry.title: Heegaard splittings of compact 3-manifolds
entry.summary: An expository survey article on Heegaard splittings

entry.title: Digital Shy Maps
entry.summary: We study properties of shy maps in digital topology.

entry.title: Lefschetz Fibrations and 3-Fold Branched Covering Spaces
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn by the author. See math.GT/9811093 for replacement.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is withdrawn by the author. See math.GT/9811093 for replacement

entry.title: A short visit into the Dehn filling Theory
entry.summary: This article was withdrawn by the arXiv.org administrators since it plagiarizes math.GT/0011056.
entry.arxiv:comment: This article was withdrawn by the arXiv.org administrators since it plagiarizes math.GT/0011056

entry.title: Triviality of the Odd-Degree Part of the Space of Three-Loop Finite-Type Invariants
entry.summary: Withdrawn by the author in favour of math.GT/0511602

entry.title: Khovanov's conjecture over Z[c]
entry.summary: We disprove the conjecture of M. Khovanov (math.QA/9908171) on the functoriality of his link homology with polynomial coefficients. This is in contrast to the case of integer coefficients, where functoriality was proved in math.GT/0206303 .

entry.title: The L-Move and Virtual Braids
entry.summary: This paper is a short introduction to and statement of the main theorems of our paper "Virtual Braids and the L-Move", JKTR, Vol. 15, No. 6 (2006), pp. 773-811. See also arxiv:Math.GT/0507035.

entry.title: Geometrization of 3-dimensional orbifolds, Part I: Geometry of cone manifolds
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn, because its material has been revised and became part of paper math.GT/0010184
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn, because its material has been revised and became part of paper math.GT/0010184

entry.title: Stable super summit sets in Garside groups
entry.summary: withdrawn and included in our new manuscript "Abelian subgroups of Garside groups", math.GT/0609683
entry.arxiv:comment: withdrawn and included in our new manuscript "Abelian subgroups of Garside groups", math.GT/0609683

entry.title: Manifolds not containing Gompf nuclei
entry.summary: In this note we show that there are 4-manifolds not containing Gompf nucleus $N_2$; in this way we answer Problem 4.98 of Kirby's problem list in the negative.

entry.title: Real trees in topology, geometry, and group theory
entry.summary: This is a survey of the theory of real trees and their applications.

entry.title: A survey of 4-manifolds through the eyes of surgery
entry.summary: The title says it all.
entry.arxiv:comment: 25 pages. To appear in Wall's 60th birthday volume

entry.title: Additivity of free genus of knots
entry.summary: We show that free genus of knots is additive under connected sum.

entry.title: The symplectic Floer homology of the figure eight knot
entry.summary: In this paper, we compute the symplectic Floer homology of the figure eight knot. This provides first nontrivial knot with trivial symplectic Floer homology.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX2e plus AMS style files, 6 pages

entry.title: A Natural Framing for Asymptotically Flat Integral Homology 3-Sphere
entry.summary: For an integral homology 3-sphere embedded asymptotically flatly in an Euclidean space, we find a natural framing extending the standard trivialization on the asymptotically flat part.

entry.title: A fake cusp and a fishtail
entry.summary: We construct smooth 4-manifolds that are homeomorphic but not diffeomorphic to the "cusp" and the "fishtail", which are certain thickened singular 2-spheres.

entry.title: On endomorphisms of surface mapping class groups
entry.summary: We prove that every endomorphism of the mapping class group of an orientable surface onto a subgroup of finite index is in fact an automorphism.

entry.title: Characters of SL(2) Representations of Groups
entry.summary: We determine the characters of SL(2) representations of groups and surface groups.

entry.title: Automorphisms of Thurston's Space of Measured Laminations
entry.summary: We give a characterization of the action of the mapping class group on Thurston's space of measured laminations.

entry.title: Some Applications of a Multiplicative Structure on Simple Loops in Surfaces
entry.summary: We discuss some applications of an intrinsic multipication in the space of simple loops in a surface.

entry.title: On the non-existence of tight contact structures
entry.summary: We exhibit a 3-manifold which admits no tight contact structure.

entry.title: Every Coxeter group acts amenably on a compact space
entry.summary: Coxeter groups admit amenable actions on compact spaces. Moreover, they have finite asymptotic dimension.

entry.title: Any 3-manifold 1-dominates at most finitely many geometric 3-manifolds
entry.summary: In this paper, we proved that any closed orientable 3-manifold 1-dominates at most finitely many geometric 3-manifolds.

entry.title: Une infinite de structures de contact tendues sur les varietes toroidales
entry.summary: We show that every closed toroidal irreducible orientable 3-manifold carries infinitely many universally tight contact structures.

entry.title: A proof of a homeomorphism theorem of Waldhausen
entry.summary: We give a short proof of Waldhausen's homeomorphism theorem for orientable Haken 3-manifolds.

entry.title: On presentation of Surface Braid Groups
entry.summary: We give presentations of braid groups and pure braid groups on surfaces.

entry.title: A calculus for shadows of smooth 4-manifolds
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the author due an error in the proof of Theorem 3.2.

entry.title: The automorphism group of the pants complex
entry.summary: We show that the automorphism group of the complex of pants decompositions for a surface is isomorphic to the mapping class group for that surface.

entry.title: Isotopies of planar compacta need not extend to isotopies of planar continua
entry.summary: We construct an isotopy of a planar compactum that is not the restriction of an isotopy of any planar continuum.

entry.title: Invariants of 3-manifolds from representations of the framed-tangle category
entry.summary: A new class of 3-manifold invariants is constructed from representations of the category of framed tangles.

entry.title: Scharlemann-Thompson untelescoping of Heegaard splittings is finer than Casson-Gordon's
entry.summary: We show that Scharlemann-Thompson untelescoping of Heegaard splittings is finer than Casson-Gordon's by giving concrete examples.

entry.title: Genus 2 closed hyperbolic 3-manifolds of arbitrarily large volume
entry.summary: We describe a class of genus 2 closed hyperbolic 3-manifolds of arbitrarily large volume.

entry.title: Higher Order Invariants of Immersions of Surfaces into 3-Space
entry.summary: We classify all finite order invariants of immersions of a closed orientable surface into R^3, with values in any Abelian group. We show that they are all functions of order one invariants.

entry.title: Ideal triangulations of finite volume hyperbolic 3-manifolds
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn (temporarily?) by the author since an error needs to be corrected.

entry.title: Heegaard splittings and virtually Haken Dehn filling
entry.summary: We use Heegaard splittings to give some examples of virtually Haken 3-manifolds.

entry.title: Torsions of 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We give a brief survey of abelian torsions of 3-manifolds.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Geometry and Topology Monographs at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/gt/GTMon4/paper19.abs.html

entry.title: Projective structures with degenerate holonomy and the Bers density conjecture
entry.summary: We prove the Bers' density conjecture for singly degenerate Kleinian surfaces groups without parabolics.

entry.title: (-2,3,7)-pretzel knot and Reebless foliation
entry.summary: If p/q > 18, p is odd, and $p/q \ne 37/2$, (p,q)-Dehn surgery for the (-2,3,7)-pretzel knot produces a 3-manifold without Reebless foliation.

entry.title: Mayberry-Murasugi's formula for links in homology 3-spheres
entry.summary: We prove Mayberry-Murasugi's formula for links in homology 3-spheres, which was proved before only for links in the 3-sphere. Our proof uses Franz-Reidemeister torsions.

entry.title: A note on pseudo-Anosov maps with small growth rate
entry.summary: We present an explicit sequence of pseudo-Anosov maps $\phi_k: S_{2k}\to S_{2k}$ of surfaces of genus $2k$ whose growth rates converge to one.

entry.title: Geometric deformations of immersed surfaces in non-positively curved manifolds
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to serious error found in main argument.

entry.title: Heegaard Floer homologies of pretzel knots
entry.summary: We compute the Ozsv\'ath-Szab\'o Heegaard Floer homology of three stranded pretzel knots.

entry.title: The Pants Complex Has Only One End
entry.summary: The authors prove that for a closed surface of genus at least 3, the graph of pants decompositions has only one end.

entry.title: Finite order invariants for $(n,2)$-torus knots and the curve $Y^2=X^3+X^2$
entry.summary: We describe the algebra of finite order invariants on the set of all $(n,2)$-torus knots.

entry.title: A characterization of the Murasugi polynomial of an equivariant slice knot
entry.summary: We characterize the Murasugi polynomial of an equivariant slice knot by proving a conjecture of J. Davis and S. Naik.

entry.title: Heegaard-Floer Homology and a family of Brieskorn spheres
entry.summary: We compute the Heegaard-Floer homology for the family Sigma(2,3,6n+1) of Brieskorn spheres using the algorithm by P. Ozsvath and Z. Szabo

entry.title: Finite Type Invariants
entry.summary: This is an overview article on finite type invariants, written for the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics

entry.title: Virtual links are algorithmically recognisable
entry.summary: We prove that there is an algorithm to decide whehter two virtual links are equivalent or not

entry.title: On the Heegaard Floer homology of S^3_{-p/q}(K)
entry.summary: We compute the Heegaard Floer homology of an oriented 3-manifold obtained by a negative rational surgery along an arbitrary algebraic knot.

entry.title: Small Exotic 4-manifolds with b_2^+=3
entry.summary: We construct an infinite family of simply connected, pairwise nondiffeomorphic 4-manifolds, all homeomorphic to 3CP^2 blown up at 9 points.

entry.title: Khovanov's invariant for closed surfaces
entry.summary: We compute the Khovanov-Jacobsson number of an embedded torus in R^4. The answer is always 2, regardless of the embedding.

entry.title: A Characterization of Quintic Helices
entry.summary: A polynomial curve of degree 5, $\alpha$, is a helix, if and only if both $||\alpha^'||$ and $||\alpha^'\wedge \alpha^{''}||$ are polynomial functions.

entry.title: On the Archimedean or Semiregular Polyhedra
entry.summary: We prove that there are thirteen Archimedean/semiregular polyhedra by using Euler's polyhedral formula.

entry.title: Alexander polynomials of doubly primitive knots
entry.summary: We give a formula for Alexander polynomials of doubly primitive knots.

entry.title: Simplicity of QC(S^n) and LIP(S^n)
entry.summary: We prove that the groups of orientation preserving quasiconformal or bilipschitz homeomorphisms of S^n are simple in dimensions 2 and higher.

entry.title: Finite type invariants of 3-manifolds
entry.summary: This is a survey article on finite type invariants of 3-manifolds written for the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics to be published by Elsevier.

entry.title: Immersions of Surfaces into Aspherical 3-Manifolds
entry.summary: We study finite order invariants of null-homotopic immersions of a closed orientable surface into an aspherical orientable 3-manifold. We give the foundational constructions, and classify all order one invariants.

entry.title: Finiteness of arithmetic Kleinian reflection groups
entry.summary: We prove that there are only finitely many arithmetic Kleinian maximal reflection groups.

entry.title: The topology and geometry of contact structures in dimension three
entry.summary: The goal of this article is to survey recent developments in the theory of contact structures in dimension three.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages. To appear in the ICM 2006 proceedings

entry.title: Uniformization By Classical Schottky Groups
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an error in an inequality in the proof of Theorem 1.1.

entry.title: A Fake $CP^2 #4 {\bar CP^2}$
entry.summary: This paper is not ready for public consumption, as the last step (Figure 20) is incorrect.

entry.title: Knots and k-width
entry.summary: We investigate several integer invariants of curves in 3-space. We demonstrate relationships of these invariants to crossing number and to total curvature.

entry.title: Rational surgery formula for Habiro-Le invariants of rational homology 3-spheres
entry.summary: The results become part of an upcoming paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Morse functions statistics
entry.summary: We answer a question of V.I. Arnold concerning the growth rate of the number of Morse functions on the two sphere.

entry.title: Moebius bands with a quasipositive fibred hole
entry.summary: We prove that every knot in the 3-space bounds an embedded punctured Moebius band whose other boundary component is a quasipositive fibred knot.

entry.title: Dimension-raising theorems for cohomological and extension dimensions
entry.summary: We establish cohomological and extension dimension versions of the Hurewicz dimension-raising theorem

entry.title: A property of diagrams of the trivial knot
entry.summary: In this paper, we give a necessary condition for a diagram to represent the trivial knot.

entry.title: Nonnegative Grassman Chambers are Balls
entry.summary: The radius of the star-shaped set need not have been continuous.

entry.title: Alternating Augmentations of Links
entry.summary: We show that one can interweave an unknot into any non-alternating connected projection of a link so that the resulting augmented projection is alternating.

entry.title: The end of the curve complex
entry.summary: Suppose that S is a surface of genus two or more, with exactly one boundary component. Then the curve complex of S has one end.

entry.title: A homological recipe for pseudo-Anosovs
entry.summary: We give a simple explicit construction of pseudo-Anosov mapping classes using an improvement of the homological criterion of Casson-Bleiler.

entry.title: On the codimension-one foliation theorem of W. Thurston
entry.summary: This article has been withdrawn due to a mistake which is explained in version 2.

entry.title: Coloring $n$-String Tangles
entry.summary: This expository paper describes how the knot invariant Fox coloring can be applied to tangles.

entry.title: A controlled-topology proof of the product structure theorem
entry.summary: The controlled end and h-cobrodism theorems (Ends of maps I, 1979) are used to give quick proofs of the Top/PL and PL/DIFF product structure theorems.

entry.title: Foliations invariant under Lie group transverse actions
entry.summary: In this paper we study (smooth and holomorphic) foliations which are invariant under transverse actions of Lie groups.

entry.title: Virtual betti numbers of symmetric spaces
entry.summary: We prove that a closed arithmetic hyperbolic 3-manifold with positive first betti number has virtually infinite first betti number.

entry.title: Systoles of hyperbolic 4-manifolds
entry.summary: We prove that for any \e>0, there exists a closed hyperbolic 4-manifold with a closed geodesic of length < \e.

entry.title: A formula for the Euler characteristics of even dimensional triangulated manifolds
entry.summary: An unusual formula for the Euler characteristics of even dimensional triangulated manifolds is deduced from the generalized Dehn-Sommerville equations.

entry.title: Cobordism of knots on surfaces
entry.summary: We introduce a relation of cobordism for knots in thickened surfaces and study cobordism invariants of such knots.

entry.title: Surface Bundles With Non-Zero Signature
entry.summary: In this paper we develop a new technique that yields infinitely many surface bundles with non-zero signature.

entry.title: Ascending number of knots and links
entry.summary: We introduce a new numerical invariant of knots and links from the descending diagrams. It is considered to live between the unknotting number and the bridge number.

entry.title: Edge number of knots and links
entry.summary: We introduce a new numerical invariant of knots and links made from the partitioned diagrams. It measures the complexity of knots and links.

entry.title: Kleinian groups with ubiquitous surface subgroups
entry.summary: We show that every finitely-generated free subgroup of a right-angled, co-compact Kleinian reflection group is contained in a surface subgroup.

entry.title: Near-homeomorphisms of Nobeling manifolds
entry.summary: We characterize maps between $n$-dimensional N\"obeling manifolds that can be approximated by homeomorphisms.

entry.title: An invariant for flat virtual knots
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the author, due to a critical error stemming from the defined template.

entry.title: Some pseudo-Anosov maps on punctured Riemann surfaces represented by multi-twists
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Invariants of Knot Diagrams
entry.summary: We construct a new order 1 invariant for knot diagrams. We use it to determine the minimal number of Reidemeister moves needed to pass between certain pairs of knot diagrams.

entry.title: Small index subgroups of the mapping class group
entry.summary: We prove that the mapping class group of a closed oriented surface of genus $\rho \ge 3$ has no proper subgroup of index $\le 4 \rho +4$.

entry.title: Order one invariants of planar curves
entry.summary: We give a complete description of all order 1 invariants of planar curves.

entry.title: A JSJ splitting for triangulated open 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We give a sufficient condition for an open 3-manifold to admit a decomposition along properly embedded open annuli and tori, generalizing the toric splitting of Jaco-Shalen and Johannson.

entry.title: 3-Dimensional Schlaefli Formula and Its Generalization
entry.summary: Several identities similar to the Schlaefli formula are established for tetrahedra in a space of constant curvature.

entry.title: Minimality of the well-rounded retract
entry.summary: We prove that the well-rounded retract of SO_n\SL_n(R) is a minimal SL_n(Z)-invariant spine.

entry.title: A note on combinatorial splicing formulas for Heegaard Floer homology
entry.summary: We give a precise description of splicing formulas from a previous paper in terms of knot Floer complex associated with a knot in homology sphere.

entry.title: Correction to ``Knotted Hamiltonian cycles in spatial embeddings of complete graphs"
entry.summary: We state and prove a correct version of a theorem presented in an earlier paper.

entry.title: Corrigendum to "Knot Floer homology detects fibred knots"
entry.summary: We correct a mistake on the citation of JSJ theory in \cite{Ni}. Some arguments in \cite{Ni} are also slightly modified accordingly.

entry.title: Addendum to: "Knots, sutures and excision"
entry.summary: We observe that the main theorem in \cite{KMsuture} immediately implies its analogue for closed 3--manifolds.

entry.title: Quandle-like Structures From Groups
entry.summary: We define a class of quandle-like structures called pseudoquandles and analyze some of their algebraic properties.

entry.title: Finite type invariants of words and Arnold's invariants
entry.summary: We define a new finite type invariant for stably homeomorphic class of curves on compact oriented surfaces without boundaries and extend to a regular homotopy invariant for spherical curves.

entry.title: Positive Legendrian regular homotopies
entry.summary: In contrast with what happens for Legendrian embeddings, there always exist positive loops of Legendrian immersions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: New perspectives and challenges in symplectic topology, Stanford : \'Etats-Unis d'Am\'erique (2007)

entry.title: Dehn twists have roots
entry.summary: We construct nontrivial roots of Dehn twists about nonseparating curves.

entry.title: Quandle and hyperbolic volume
entry.summary: We show that the hyperbolic volume of a hyperbolic knot is a quandle cocycle invariant. Further we show that it completely determines invertibility and positive/negative amphicheirality of hyperbolic knots.

entry.title: Simplicial embeddings between pants graphs
entry.summary: We prove that, except in some low-complexity cases, every locally injective simplicial map between pants graphs is induced by a $\pi_1$-injective embedding between the corresponding surfaces.

entry.title: Hyperbolic Volume of Link Families
entry.summary: For families of knots and links given in Conway notation we compute lower maximal and upper minimal bound of hyperbolic volume by using source links and augmented links.

entry.title: The space of Kleinian punctured torus groups is not locally connected
entry.summary: We show that the space of Kleinian punctured torus groups is not locally connected.

entry.title: Circle immersions that can be divided into two arc embeddings
entry.summary: We give a complete characterization of a circle immersion that can be divided into two arc embeddings in terms of its chord diagram.

entry.title: On L-spaces and non left-orderable 3-manifold groups
entry.summary: We show that a class of 3-manifolds with non left-orderable fundamental group are Heegaard Floer homology L-spaces

entry.title: Mutation invariance of Khovanov homology over $\mathbb{F}_2$
entry.summary: We prove that Khovanov homology and Lee homology with coefficients in $\mathbb{F}_2$ are invariant under component-preserving link mutations.

entry.title: Reidemeister torsion and analytic torsion of spheres
entry.summary: We provide a simple topological derivation of a formula for the Reidemeister and the analityc torsion of spheres.

entry.title: Topics in Heegaard Floer homology
entry.summary: This is the author's PhD thesis, as submitted to the Princeton University. The results of this paper have already appeared in arXiv:math/0607777v4, arXiv:math/0607691 and arXiv:0901.2156.

entry.title: Commensurability of Surface Automorphisms \\and surface bundles over $S^1$
entry.summary: This note will become part of a new paper with more authors.

entry.title: PL-virtual knots
entry.summary: Piecewise-linear virtual knots are discussed and classified up to edge index six.

entry.title: A Note on Topologically-Trivial Braids
entry.summary: We give a simple characterization of braids that can be unplaited keeping separately their upper ends and their lower ends tied together

entry.title: Free Knos are Not Invertible
entry.summary: By using parity arguments we prove that free knots are, generally, not invertible.

entry.title: Erratum to "Cobordisms of maps with singularities of given class"
entry.summary: We correct the proof in the unoriented case of Theorem 1.2 in the paper "Cobordisms of maps with singularities of given class"

entry.title: A Diagramless Link Homology
entry.summary: A link homology is defined that is independent of link diagrams. This diagramless homology is closely related to Khovanov homology.

entry.title: On the figure-8 surgery of S^2\times S^2
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn as Lemma 2 is incorrect.

entry.title: Symmetries of geometric flows
entry.summary: By applying the theory of group-invariant solutions we investigate the symmetries of Ricci flow and hyperbolic geometric flow both on Riemann surfaces. The warped products on $\mathcal {S}^{n+1}$ of both flows are also studied.

entry.title: Two classes of virtually fibered Montesinos links of type $\widetilde{SL_2}$
entry.summary: We find two new classes of virtually fibered classic Montesinos links of type $\widetilde{SL_2}$.

entry.title: On homotopical and homological $Z_n$-sets
entry.summary: We survey some properties of homotopical and homological $Z_n$-sets in topological spaces.

entry.title: A semigroup of theta-curves in 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We establish an existence and uniqueness theorem for prime decompositions of theta-curves in $3$-manifolds.

entry.title: On macroscopic dimension of rationally essential manifolds
entry.summary: We construct a counterexamples in dimensions $n>3$ to Gromov's conjecture \cite{Gr1} that the macroscopic dimension of rationally essential $n$-dimensional manifolds equals $n$.

entry.title: Examples of unstabilized critical Heegaard surfaces
entry.summary: We show that the standard minimal genus Heegaard splitting of (closed orientable surface)\times S^1 is a critical Heegaard splitting.

entry.title: Odd Khovanov homology of principally unimodular bipartite graph-links
entry.summary: We define integral odd Khovanov homology of principally unimodular bipartite graph-links.

entry.title: Invariants from the Linking Number
entry.summary: We explore a family of invariants obtained from linking numbers. This is a family of Kauffman finite type invariants.

entry.title: On the topology of stable maps
entry.summary: We investigate how Viro's integral calculus applies for the study of the topology of stable maps. We also discuss several applications to Morin maps and complex maps.

entry.title: Identifying the Canonical Component for the Whitehead Link
entry.summary: In this paper we determine topologically the canonical component of the $SL_2(\mathbb{C})$ character variety of the Whitehead link complement.

entry.title: A note on knots with H(2)-unknotting number one
entry.summary: We give an obstruction to unknotting a knot by adding a twisted band, derived from Heegaard Floer homology.

entry.title: Invitation to Topological Conformal Field Theories
entry.summary: Topological conformal field theories are defined using only basic results from the theory of quasiconformal mappings.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted as an MSc thesis to the Hebrew U. of Jerusalem

entry.title: Layered models for closed 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We define a combinatorial structure on 3-manifolds that combines the model manifolds constructed in Minsky's proof of the ending lamination conjecture with the layered triangulations defined by Jaco and Rubinstein.

entry.title: Tunnel One, Fibered Links
entry.summary: Let K be a tunnel number one, fibered link in S^3, with fiber F, and unknotting tunnel $\tau$. We show that $\tau$ can be isotoped to lie in F.

entry.title: The K-theoretic Farrell-Jones conjecture for CAT(0)-groups
entry.summary: We prove the K-theoretic Farrell-Jones conjecture with (twisted) coefficients for CAT(0)-groups.

entry.title: On Long Virtual Biquanles
entry.summary: Virtual quandles with two operations are discussed in the article. Certain knot invariant is constructed and used to distinguish two long virtual knots.

entry.title: Khovanov-Rozansky Homology and Conway Mutation
entry.summary: We show that the reduced sl(n) homology defined by Khovanov and Rozansky is invariant under component-preserving positive mutation when n is odd.

entry.title: Nash homotopy spheres are standard
entry.summary: We prove that the infinite family of homotopy 4-spheres constructed by Daniel Nash are all diffeomorphic to 4-sphere.

entry.title: The limit set of the handlebody set has measure zero
entry.summary: This note fixes a small gap in Kerckhoff's proof that the limit set of the handlebody set has measure zero.

entry.title: Correction to "A smooth foliation of the 5-sphere by complex surfaces"
entry.summary: We explain an error in our paper "A smooth foliation of the 5-sphere by complex surfaces", Ann. Math 156 (2002), p.915-930.

entry.title: Geodesics, volumes and Lehmer's conjecture
entry.summary: In this report I discuss the relations between systoles and volumes of hyperbolic manifolds and a conjecture of Lehmer about the Mahler measure of non-cyclotomic polynomials.

entry.title: Exceptional surgeries on components of two-bridge links
entry.summary: In this paper, we give a complete classification of exceptional Dehn surgeries on a component of a hyperbolic two-bridge link in the 3-sphere.

entry.title: Khovanov Homology
entry.summary: This paper is an introduction to Khovanov homology.

entry.title: Another Veech Triangle
entry.summary: We show that the triangle with angles Pi/12, Pi/3 and 7*Pi/12 has the lattice property and compute this triangle's Veech group.
entry.arxiv:comment: covers material in my 2006 PhD thesis, 9 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: A Remark on Roberts' Totally Twisted Khovanov Homology
entry.summary: We offer an alternative construction of Roberts' totally twisted Khovanov homology and prove that it agrees with delta-graded reduced characteristic-2 Khovanov homology.

entry.title: On composite twisted torus knots
entry.summary: In the present note, we will show that there are infinitely many composite twisted torus knots.

entry.title: Additivity of Circular Width
entry.summary: We show that circular width is preserved under connected sum of knots for some cases.

entry.title: Cobordism of exact links
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce the notion of exact links, which constitute a broad class of high dimensional links.

entry.title: The ideals of the homological Goldman Lie algebra
entry.summary: We determine all the ideals of the homological Goldman Lie algebra, which reflects the structure of an oriented surface.

entry.title: On Jones polynomials of alternating pretzel knots
entry.summary: We show that there are infinitely many pairs of alternating pretzel knots whose Jones polynomials are identical.

entry.title: Quaternionic hyperbolic Fuchsian groups
entry.summary: In this paper we give the characterization of Fuchsian groups acting on quaternionic hyperbolic 2-space.

entry.title: A diagrammatic Alexander invariant of tangles
entry.summary: We give a new construction of the one-variable Alexander polynomial of an oriented knot or link, and show that it generalizes to a vector valued invariant of oriented tangles.

entry.title: A Cantor set with hyperbolic complement
entry.summary: We construct a Cantor set in S^3 whose complement admits a complete hyperbolic metric.

entry.title: La conjecture des sous-groupes de surfaces (d'après Jeremy Kahn et Vladimir Markovic)
entry.summary: This is the text of my Bourbaki seminar on the proof of the surface subgroup conjecture by Jeremy Kahn and Vladimir Markovic.

entry.title: On some impossible disentanglement puzzles
entry.summary: In this article we prove the impossibility of some disentanglement puzzles, first building mathematical models that reflect the essential characteristics of these puzzles.

entry.title: An algorithmic classification of open surfaces
entry.summary: We propose a formulation for the homeomorphism problem for open n-dimensional manifolds and use the Kerekjarto classification theorem to solve this problem for n=2.

entry.title: Fiberwise Intersection Theory
entry.summary: We define a bordism invariant for the fiberwise intersection theory. Under some certain conditions, this invariant is an obstruction for the theory.

entry.title: Invariants preserved by mutation
entry.summary: We prove that generalized mutation preserves several geometric invariants such as the volume and Goncharov invariant of Q-rank 1 locally symmetric spaces.

entry.title: Small 3-manifolds with large Heegaard distance
entry.summary: We construct examples of closed non-Haken hyperbolic 3-manifolds with a Heegaard splitting of arbitrarily large distance.

entry.title: Surface topology and involutive bimodules
entry.summary: We remark some basic facts on homological aspects of involutive Lie bialgebras and their involutive bimodules, and present some problems on surface topology related to these facts.

entry.title: On topologically minimal surfaces of high genus
entry.summary: We show that a 3-manifold containing an incompressible surface has topologically minimal surfaces of arbitrary high genus.

entry.title: Virtual Genus of Satellite Links
entry.summary: The virtual genus of a virtual satellite link is equal to that of its companion.

entry.title: Intrinsic Chirality of Multipartite Graphs
entry.summary: We classify which complete multipartite graphs are intrinsically chiral.

entry.title: Composite tunnel number one genus two handlebody-knots
entry.summary: We characterize composite tunnel number one genus two handlebody-knots.

entry.title: Removing Colors 2k, 2k-1, and k
entry.summary: We prove that if a link admits non-trivial (2k+1)-colorings, with prime 2k+1>7, it also admits non-trivial (2k+1)-colorings not involving colors 2k, 2k-1, nor k.

entry.title: Extensions of maps to M(Z_m,1)
entry.summary: We show that a Moore space M(Z_m,1) is an absolute extensor for finite dimensional metrizable spaces of cohomological dimension dim_{Z_m} \leq 1.

entry.title: Constructing non-uniquely ergodic arational trees
entry.summary: In this technical note, we adapt an idea of Gabai to construct non-uniquely ergodic, non-geometric, arational trees.

entry.title: The volume of positive braid links
entry.summary: Based on recent work by Futer, Kalfagianni and Purcell, we prove that the volume of sufficiently complicated positive braid links is proportional to the signature defect $\Delta \sigma=2g-\sigma$.

entry.title: Contact perturbations of Reebless foliations are universally tight
entry.summary: We give a complete proof of the fact that a contact structure that is sufficiently close to a Reebless foliation is universally tight.

entry.title: Goeritz Invariant of Torus Links
entry.summary: We obtain the full list of Goeritz invariants of all torus knots and links.

entry.title: Penner coordinates for closed surfaces
entry.summary: Penner coordinates are extended to the Teichm\"uller spaces of oriented closed surfaces.

entry.title: An explicit formula for the A-polynomial of twist knots
entry.summary: We extend Hoste-Shanahan's calculations for the A-polynomial of twist knots, to give an explicit formula.

entry.title: Measured lamination spaces for surface pairs
entry.summary: We calculate a projective space of essential measured laminations in a surface pair, which will be used in another paper to help describe spaces of "finite height laminations."

entry.title: Geometric simple connectivity and finitely presented groups
entry.summary: This is the second of a Series of three papers, the first one published in Geom Dedicata 167 p. 91-121 (2013), proving that all finitely presented groups are QSF.

entry.title: Crossing Change Alternating Knots
entry.summary: In this paper we define Crossing Change Alternating Knots (CCA knots) and their generalization: $k$-CCA knots.

entry.title: Quasi-alternating links and $Q$-polynomials
entry.summary: Qazaqzeh and Chbili showed that for any quasi-alternating link, the degree of $Q$-polynomial is less than its determinant. We give a refinement of their evaluation.

entry.title: On the stable 4-genus of knots with indefinite Seifert form
entry.summary: Under a simple assumption on Seifert surfaces, we characterise knots whose stable topological 4-genus coincides with the genus.

entry.title: Michel Kervaire work on knots in higher dimensions
entry.summary: We present Michel Kervaire work on knots in higher dimensions.

entry.title: All finitely presented groups are QSF
entry.summary: This is the third and last of three papers containing the complete proof that all finitely presented groups are QSF.

entry.title: Proportionality Principle for the Lipschitz simplicial volume
entry.summary: We prove the Proportionality Principle for the Lipschitz simplicial volume without any restriction on curvature. Our argument is based on the construction of a suitable \emph{pseudostraightening} for simplices.

entry.title: Growth functions of Coxeter groups, Poincare series of singularities and $2$-tangle $q$-fractions
entry.summary: Growth functions of Coxeter groups and the Poincare series of Kleinian and Fuchsian singularities are $2$-tangle $q$-fractions.

entry.title: Criteria for Morin singularities into higher dimensions
entry.summary: We give criteria for Morin singularities into higher dimensions. As an application, we study the number of A-isotopy classes of Morin singularities.

entry.title: 3-manifolds that can be made acyclic
entry.summary: We determine which 3-manifolds admit a unitary representation such that the corresponding twisted chain complex is acyclic.

entry.title: A cabling formula for $ν^+$ invariant
entry.summary: We prove a cabling formula for the concordance invariant $\nu^+$, defined by the author and Hom. This gives rise to a simple and effective 4-ball genus bound for many cable knots.

entry.title: Note on the distortion of (2,q)-torus knots
entry.summary: We show that the distortion of the (2,q)-torus knot is not bounded linearly from below.

entry.title: Hyperbolic Coxeter groups with Sierpiński carpet boundary
entry.summary: We give a necessary and sufficient condition for a hyperbolic Coxeter group with planar nerve to have Sierpi\'nski curve as its Gromov boundary.

entry.title: Dehn's Algorithm for Simple Diagrams
entry.summary: A version of Dehn's algorithm for simple diagrams on a once punctured surface representing simple diagrams on a closed surface is presented

entry.title: A criterion for the Legendrian simplicity of the connected sum
entry.summary: In this paper, we provide the necessary and sufficient conditions for the connected sum of knots in $S^3$ to be Legendrian simple.

entry.title: Kirby diagrams and the Ratcliffe-Tschantz hyperbolic 4-manifolds
entry.summary: We show how to construct a Kirby diagram for a large class of finite volume hyperbolic 4-manifolds constructed by J. Ratcliffe and S. Tschantz.

entry.title: The classification of some GK-trisections
entry.summary: We classify a large class of "unbalanced" 4-manifold GK-trisections, which are a slight generalization of 4-manifold trisections defined by Gay and Kirby.

entry.title: Lissajous and Fourier Knots
entry.summary: We prove that any knot of $\mathbb{R}^3$ is isotopic to a Fourier knot of type $(1,1,2)$ obtained by deformation of a Lissajous knot.

entry.title: Coarse hyperbolicity and closed orbits for quasigeodesic flows
entry.summary: We prove Calegari's conjecture that every quasigeodesic flow on a closed hyperbolic 3-manifold has closed orbits.

entry.title: Cubical simplicial volume of 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We prove that cubical simplicial volume of oriented closed 3-manifolds is equal to one fifth of ordinary simplicial volume.

entry.title: The warping matrix of a knot diagram
entry.summary: We introduce the warping matrix which is a new description of oriented knots from a viewpoint of warping degree.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 8 figures, to appear in the Contemporary Mathematics

entry.title: Topological rigidity of higher graph manifolds
entry.summary: In this short note we prove the Borel conjecture for a family of aspherical manifolds that includes higher graph manifolds.

entry.title: Crossing changes, Delta moves, and sharp moves on welded knots
entry.summary: We prove that the crossing changes, Delta moves, and sharp moves are unknotting operations on welded knots.

entry.title: Elliptic Involution on Knot Complements
entry.summary: We show that Bordered Heegaard Floer invariant $\widehat{CFD}$ of a knot complement in $S^3$ is invariant under the elliptic involution on its boundary.

entry.title: Bipyramids and bounds on volumes of hyperbolic links
entry.summary: We utilize ideal bipyramids to obtain new upper bounds on volume for hyperbolic link complements in terms of the combinatorics of their projections.

entry.title: On the 3-dimensional invariant for cyclic contact branched coverings
entry.summary: We give a formula of 3-dimensional invariant for a cyclic contact branched covering of the standard contact S^{3}.

entry.title: Satellite knots and L-space surgeries
entry.summary: We give sufficient conditions for a satellite knot to admit an L-space surgery, and use this result to give new infinite families of patterns which produce satellite L-space knots.

entry.title: Heegaard Diagrams of $S^3$ and the Andrews-Curtis Conjecture
entry.summary: We show that the Andrews-Curtis conjecture holds for all balanced presentations of the trivial group corresponding to Heegaard diagrams of $S^3$.

entry.title: Riley's Conjecture on SL(2,R) Representations of 2-Bridge Knots
entry.summary: We prove Riley's conjecture on the number of parabolic SL(2,R) representations of 2-bridge knot groups.

entry.title: Minimal dilatation in Penner's construction
entry.summary: For all orientable closed surfaces, we determine the minimal dilatation among mapping classes arising from Penner's construction. We also discuss generalisations to surfaces with punctures.

entry.title: Adjoint twisted Alexander polynomials of genus one two-bridge knots
entry.summary: We give explicit formulas for the adjoint twisted Alexander polynomial and the nonabelian Reidemeister torsion of genus one two-bridge knots.

entry.title: A random link via bridge position is hyperbolic
entry.summary: We show that a random link defined by random bridge splitting is hyperbolic with asymptotic probability 1.

entry.title: Graphs of hyperbolic groups and a limit set intersection theorem
entry.summary: Minor changes in the exposition and small corrections on the previous version.

entry.title: Fillability of small Seifert fibered spaces
entry.summary: We characterize fillable structures among zero-twisting contact structures on small Seifert fibered spaces of the form M(-1; r_1, r_2, r_3).

entry.title: The Heisenberg group acts on a strictly convex domain
entry.summary: This paper gives the first example of a unipotent group that is not virtually abelian and preserves a strictly convex domain.

entry.title: Surgery on Paracompact Manifolds
entry.summary: This is a TeX'ed version of the author's 1971 thesis from the University of California at Berkeley under the supervision of J.~B.~Wagoner.

entry.title: All smooth four-dimensional Schoenflies balls are geometrically simply connected
entry.summary: This paper gives a complete proof of the result announced in the title.

entry.title: Universal Minimal Flow in the Theory of Topological Groupoids
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate some connections between Topological Dynamics, the theory of G-Principal Bundles, and the theory of Locally Trivial Groupoids.

entry.title: On moduli spaces of positive scalar curvature metrics on certain manifolds
entry.summary: We show that the homotopy groups of moduli spaces of positive scalar curvature metrics on certain simply connected spin manifolds are non-trivial.

entry.title: Manifold Calculus Adapted for Simplicial Complexes
entry.summary: We develop a generalization of manifold calculus where the manifold is replaced by a simplicial complex.

entry.title: Discontinuous motions of limit sets
entry.summary: We characterise completely when limit sets, as parametrised by Cannon-Thurston maps, move discontinuously for a sequence of algebraically convergent quasi-Fuchsian groups.

entry.title: The classification of linked $3$-manifolds in $6$-space
entry.summary: Let $M_1$ and $M_2$ be closed connected orientable $3$-manifolds. We classify the sets of smooth and piecewise linear isotopy classes of embeddings $M_1\sqcup M_2\rightarrow S^6$.

entry.title: Geodesic triangulations exists for cusped Platonic manifolds
entry.summary: We show that if a cusped hyperbolic manifold is Platonic, i.e., can be decomposed into isometric Platonic solids, it can also be decomposed into geodesic ideal tetrahedra.

entry.title: An explicit formula for a branched covering from $\mathbb{CP}^2$ to $S^4$
entry.summary: We give an explicit formula for a 2-fold branched covering from $\mathbb{CP}^2$ to $S^4$, and relate it to other maps between quotients of $S^2\times{S^2}$.

entry.title: Shy Maps in Topology
entry.summary: There is a concept in digital topology of a shy map. We define an analogous concept for topological spaces and study its properties.

entry.title: Khovanov spectra for tangles
entry.summary: We define stable homotopy refinements of Khovanov's arc algebras and tangle invariants.

entry.title: Bridge spectra of cables of 2-bridge knots
entry.summary: We compute the bridge spectra of cables of 2-bridge knots. We also give some results about bridge spectra and distance of Montesinos knots.

entry.title: Flat triangulations and flips
entry.summary: We prove that for a given flat surface with conical singularities, any pair of flat triangulations can be connected by a chain of flips.

entry.title: The Alexander polynomial at prime powers
entry.summary: When $K$ is a knot and $p \gg 0$ is a prime, we discuss a finite set whose cardinality is $\Delta_K(p^n)$, the value of the Alexander polynomial of $K$ at $p^n$.

entry.title: Two transformations of simple polytopes preserving moment-angle manifolds
entry.summary: We introduce two operations named biflip and puzzle-move on simple polytopes producing polytopes with diffeomorphic moment-angle manifolds.

entry.title: A note on knot concordance and involutive knot Floer homology
entry.summary: We prove that if two knots are concordant, their involutive knot Floer complexes satisfy a certain type of stable equivalence.

entry.title: Construction of infinite series of non-simple ideal hyperbolic Coxeter 4-polytopes and their growth rates
entry.summary: We construct infinite series of non-simple ideal hyperbolic Coxeter 4-polytopes whose growth rates are Perron numbers.

entry.title: Spatial refinements and Khovanov homology
entry.summary: We review the construction and context of a stable homotopy refinement of Khovanov homology.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages. Comments welcome, especially before September 25, 2017

entry.title: The virtual Thurston seminorm of 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We show that the Thurston seminorms of all finite covers of an aspherical 3-manifold determine whether it is a graph manifold, a mixed 3-manifold or hyperbolic.

entry.title: Untwisting number and Blanchfield pairings
entry.summary: In this note we use Blanchfield forms to study knots that can be turned into an unknot using a single $\overline{t}_{2k}$ move.

entry.title: Non left-orderable surgeries on negatively twisted torus knots
entry.summary: We show that certain negatively twisted torus knots admit Dehn surgeries yielding 3-manifolds with non left-orderable fundamental groups.

entry.title: Erratum: On iterated torus knots and transversal knots
entry.summary: In math.GT/0002110 the author's Theorems 1.1 and 1.2, combined, implied that iterated torus knots are transversally simple. This result is in error and this erratum pin points the error. In "An addendum on iterated torus knots" a more subtle result is proven resulting in giving a geometric realization of the Honda-Etnyre transverse (2,3)-cable of the (2,3)-torus knot example--Appendix joint with H. Matsuda. (See math.SG/0306330 and math.GT/0610566.)

entry.title: An addendum on iterated torus knots
entry.summary: In Theorem 1.2 of the paper math.GT/0002110 the author claimed to have proved that all transversal knots whose topological knot type is that of an iterated torus knot (we call them cable knots) are transversally simple. That theorem is false, and the Erratum math.GT/0610565 identifies the gap. The purpose of this paper is to explore the situation more deeply, in order to pinpoint exactly which cable knots are {\it not} transversally simple. The class is subtle and interesting. We will recover the strength of the main theorem in math.GT/0002110, in the sense that we will be able to prove a strong theorem about cable knots, but the theorem itself is more subtle than Theorem 1.2 of math.GT/0002110. In particular, we give a geometric realization of the Honda-Etnyre transverse (2,3)-cable of the (2,3)-torus knot example (Appendix joint with H. Matsuda). (See math.SG/0306330)
entry.arxiv:comment: 33 pages, 16 figures, an addendum to "On iterated torus knots and transversal knots", math.GT/0002110

entry.title: Equivariant configuration spaces
entry.summary: We use the compression theorem (arxiv:math.GT/9712235) cf section 7, to prove results for equivariant configuration spaces analogous to the well-known non-equivariant results of May, Milgram and Segal.
entry.arxiv:comment: This version incorporates changes suggested by the referee

entry.title: Quandles and Monodromy
entry.summary: We show that a variety of monodromy phenomena arising in geometric topology and algebraic geometry are most conveniently described in terms of quandle homomorphisms from a knot quandle associated to the base to a quandle associated to a fiber. We consider the cases of the monodromy of a branched covering, braid monodromy and the monodromy of a Lefschetz fibration.
entry.arxiv:comment: Much expanded version of math.GT/0201270, covering instances of monodromy beyond the monodromy of Lefschetz fibrations

entry.title: Splitting the concordance group of algebraically slice knots
entry.summary: As a corollary of work of Ozsvath and Szabo [math.GT/0301149], it is shown that the classical concordance group of algebraically slice knots has an infinite cyclic summand and in particular is not a divisible group.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Geometry and Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/gt/GTVol7/paper18.abs.html

entry.title: Addendum to "Groups of Ribbon Knots"
entry.summary: Dror Bar-Natan and Ofer Ron have questioned the accuracy of the statement on page 453, line 2 minus of my paper "Groups of Ribbon Knots", Topology Vol 37, No. 2, 441-458, that "It follows from the inductive proof that $\cal{R}_n$ is of index 2." See their article posted on arXiv: math.GT/0309282. We give here full details of how to carry out the inductive step.

entry.title: Period three actions on lens spaces
entry.summary: We show that a free period three action on a lens space is standard, i.e. the quotient is homeomorphic to a lens space. This is an extension of the result for period three actions on the three-sphere, arXiv:math.GT/0204077, by the author and J. Hyam Rubinstein.

entry.title: Positive Dehn Twist Expressions for some New Involutions in the Mapping Class Group II
entry.summary: The positive Dehn twist expressions for the generalizations of the new involutions described in math.GT/0404310 are presented. The homeomorphism types of the Lefschetz fibrations that they define are determined for several examples.

entry.title: Algebraic functions and closed braids
entry.summary: This article was originally published in Topology 22 (1983). The present hyperTeXed redaction includes references to post-1983 results as Addenda, and corrects a few typographical errors. (See math.GT/0411115 for a more comprehensive overview of the subject as it appears 21 years later.)

entry.title: Symplectic 4--manifolds with K = 0 and the Lubotzky alternative
entry.summary: In this paper we use the Lubotzky alternative for finitely generated linear groups to determine which 4-manifolds admitting a free circle action can be endowed with a symplectic structure with trivial canonical class. The content of this paper partly overlaps with the content of the unpublished preprint "Symplectic 4-manifolds with a free circle action" (arXiv:0801.1313 [math.GT]).
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages. To appear in Math. Res. Lett

entry.title: From tangle fractions to DNA
entry.summary: This paper is an introduction to rational tangles, rational knots and links and their applications to DNA. The paper can be read as an introduction to our more technical papers on rational tangles (math.GT/0311499) and on rational knots (math.GT/0212011). The present paper includes a self-contained account of the tangle fraction from the point of view of the bracket polynomial, accounts of the classification theorems for rational tangles and rational knots (and of our new proofs of these results) and a description of the use of rational tangles in studying DNA recombination.

entry.title: Braids, knots and contact structures
entry.summary: These notes were prepared to supplement the talk that I gave on Feb 19, 2004, at the First East Asian School of Knots and Related Topics, Seoul, South Korea. In this article I review aspects of the interconnections between braids, knots and contact structures on Euclidean 3-space. I discuss my recent work with William Menasco (arXiv math.GT/0310279)} and (arXiv math.GT/0310280). In the latter we prove that there are distinct transversal knot types in contact 3-space having the same topological knot type and the same Bennequin invariant.

entry.title: A note on transversal knots that are closed 3-braids
entry.summary: The contents of this 6-page paper have been subsumed into the 13-page paper, "A note on closed 3-braids", arXiv:0802.1072 [math.GT]. This paper is correct, but contains less information than the new one. The topological classification of knots that are closed braids is shown to lead to a classification theorem for transversal knots that are closed 3-braids. A list is given of all low crossing examples of transversally non-simple knots that are closed 3-braids.
entry.arxiv:comment: The contents of this 6-page paper have been subsumed into the 13-page paper, "A note on closed 3-braids", arXiv:0802.1072 [math.GT]

entry.title: Simon's conjecture for fibered knots
entry.summary: The main result of this paper, Simon's conjecture for fibered knots, was previously proven by Silver and Whitten math.GT/0405462 with essentially the same proof. This paper is therefore being withdrawn. The author would like to apologize for having missed this.
entry.arxiv:comment: The main result of this paper, Simon's conjecture for fibered knots, was previously proven by Silver and Whitten math.GT/0405462 with essentially the same proof. This paper is therefore being withdrawn. The author would like to apologize for having missed this

entry.title: Construction of symplectic structures on 4-manifolds with a free circle action
entry.summary: Let $M$ be a closed 4-manifold with a free circle action. If the orbit manifold $N^3$ satisfies an appropriate fibering condition, then we show how to represent a cone in $H^2(M;\R)$ by symplectic forms. This generalizes earlier constructions by Thurston, Bouyakoub and Fern\'andez-Gray-Morgan. In the case that $M$ is the product 4-manifold $S^1\times N$ our construction complements the results of \cite{FV08} (arXiv:0805:1234 [math.GT]) and allows us to completely determine the symplectic cone of such 4-manifolds. The content of this paper partly overlaps with the content of the unpublished preprint "Symplectic 4-manifolds with a free circle action" (arXiv:0801.1313 [math.GT]).

entry.title: Characterizing algebras of smooth functions on manifolds
entry.summary: Among all $C^\infty$-algebras we characterize those which are algebras of smooth functions on smooth separable Hausdorff manifolds.

entry.title: On the homology cobordism group of homology 3-spheres
entry.summary: In this paper we present our results on the homology cobordism group $\Th$ of the oriented integral homology 3-spheres. We specially emphasize the role played in the subject by the gauge theory including Floer homology and invariants by Donaldson and Seiberg -- Witten.

entry.title: On a computer recognition of 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We describe theoretical backgrounds for a computer program that recognizes all closed orientable 3-manifolds up to complexity 8. The program can treat also not necessarily closed 3-manifolds of bigger complexities, but here some unrecognizable (by the program) 3-manifolds may occur.

entry.title: Dehn surgery on arboresent knots and links -- a survey
entry.summary: This article is solicited by C.\ Adams for a special issue of {\it Chaos, Solitons and Fractals\/} devoted to knot theory and its applications. We present some recent results about Dehn surgeries on arborescent knots and links.

entry.title: Non-integral toroidal surgery on hyperbolic knots in $S^3$
entry.summary: We show that on any hyperbolic knot in $S^3$ there is at most one non-integral Dehn surgery which yields a manifold containing an incompressible torus.

entry.title: Sutured manifold hierarchies, essential laminations, and Dehn surgery
entry.summary: We use sutured manifold theory, essential laminations and essential branched surfaces to establish the upper bounds of distances between certain types of nonsimple Dehn surgery slopes. This is the revised version of an earlier preprint {\it Dehn surgery and simple manifolds.}

entry.title: Solvable subgroups of Out(F_n) are virtually abelian
entry.summary: A companion result of the the Tits alternative for $Out(F_n)$ is proved: Every solvable subgroup of $Out(F_n)$ is finitely generated and virtually abelian.

entry.title: Kleinian Groups Generated by Rotations
entry.summary: We discuss which Kleinian groups are commensurable with Kleinian groups generated by rotations, with particular emphasis on Kleinian groups that arise from Dehn surgery on a knot.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: "Groups -- Korea '94" Eds.: Kim/Johnson, Walter de Gruyter Verlag, Berlin - New York, 1995, 251--256

entry.title: Akbulut's corks and h-cobordisms of smooth simply connected 4-manifolds
entry.summary: This is primarily an exposition, combining work of several authors (Curtis, Hsiang, Freedman, Stong, Matveyev, and Bizaca), of the proof that a smooth 5-dimensional h-cobordism between simply connected 4-manifolds is a product off of a contractible piece which itself is diffeomorphic to the 5-ball.

entry.title: Algorithms for recognizing knots and 3-manifolds
entry.summary: This is a survey paper on algorithms for solving problems in 3-dimensional topology. In particular, it discusses Haken's approach to the recognition of the unknot, and recent variations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 Pages, 7 figures, to appear in Chaos, Fractals and Solitons

entry.title: Skein Modules and Lattice Gauge Field Theory
entry.summary: See q-alg/9710003 for the corrected version of this paper.

entry.title: On the limiting power of set of knots generated by 1+1- and 2+1- braids
entry.summary: We estimate from above the set of knots, $\Omega(n,\mu)$, generated by closure of n-string 1+1- and 2+1-dimensional braids of irreducible length $\mu$ ($\mu>>1$) in the limit n>>1.

entry.title: Four observations on n-triviality and Brunnian links
entry.summary: Brunnian links have been known for a long time in knot theory, whereas the idea of n-triviality is a recent innovation. We illustrate the relationship between the two concepts with four short theorems.

entry.title: Homologically Trivial Group Actions on 4-Manifolds
entry.summary: It is proved that an arbitrary finite group acting locally linearly, homologically trivially, and pseudofreely on a closed, simply connected 4-manifold must in fact be cyclic and act semifreely, provided the second betti number of the manifold is at least three.

entry.title: Groups Generated by Powers of Dehn Twists
entry.summary: We classify groups generated by powers of 2 Dehn twists which are 1) free or 2) have no ``unexpected'' reducible elements. We give some sufficient conditions in the case of groups generated by powers of more than two twists.

entry.title: Signatures of Lefschetz fibrations
entry.summary: Let M be a smooth 4-manifold which admits a genus g Lefschetz fibration over D^2 or S^2. We develop a technique to compute the signature of M using the global monodromy of this fibration.

entry.title: A finite presentation of the mapping class group of an oriented surface
entry.summary: We give a finite presentation of the mapping class group of an oriented (possibly bounded) surface of genus greater or equal than 1, considering Dehn twists on a very simple set of curves.

entry.title: Lagrangian Embeddings and Holomorphic Discs in the Complement of Complex Hypersurfaces
entry.summary: For a given embedded Lagrangian in the complement of a complex hypersurface we show existence of a holomorphic disc in the complement having boundary on that Lagrangian.

entry.title: Higher Skein Modules
entry.summary: We introduce higher skein modules of links generalizing the Conway skein module. We show that these modules are closely connected to the HOMFLY polynomial.

entry.title: Virtually embedded boundary slopes
entry.summary: We show that for certain hyperbolic 3-manifolds, all boundary slopes are slopes of immersed incompressible surfaces, covered by incompressible embeddings in some finite cover. The manifolds include hyperbolic punctured torus bundles and hyperbolic two-bridge knots.

entry.title: The tunnel number of the sum of n knots is at least n
entry.summary: We prove that the tunnel number of the sum of n knots is at least n.

entry.title: Hyperbolic three-manifolds with trivial finite type invariants
entry.summary: We construct a hyperbolic three-manifold with trivial finite type invariants up to a given degree.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages. Added a comment that E. Kalfagianni has already obtained similar examples using surgery along knots

entry.title: The limit configuration space integral for tangles and the Kontsevich integral
entry.summary: This article is the continuation of our first article (math/9901028). It shows how the zero-anomaly result of Yang implies the equality between the configuration space integral and the Kontsevich integral.

entry.title: Approximation of recurrence in negatively curved metric spaces
entry.summary: For metric spaces with curvature less than or equal to x, x<0, it is shown that a recurrent geodesic can be approximated by closed geodesics. A counter example is provided for the converse.

entry.title: Quantum SU(2)-invariants for three-manifolds associated with non-trivial cohomology classes modulo two
entry.summary: We show an integrality of the quantum SU(2)-invariant associated with a non-trivial first cohomology class modulo two.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, submitted to the proceedings of `Knots in Hellas 1998'

entry.title: The crossing number and maximal bridge length of a knot diagram
entry.summary: We give examples showing that Kidwell's inequality for the maximal degree of the Brandt-Lickorish-Millett-Ho polynomial is in general not sharp.

entry.title: Quantum Obstruction Theory
entry.summary: We use topological quantum field theory to derive an invariant of a three-manifold with boundary. We then show how to use this invariant as an obstruction to embedding one three-manifold in another.

entry.title: A weight system derived from the multivariable Conway potential function
entry.summary: A weight system is defined from the (multivariable) Conway potential function. We also show that it can be calculated recursively by using five axioms.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 2 figures, to appear in J. London Math. Soc

entry.title: On the Casson knot invariant
entry.summary: We study the Vassiliev knot invariant v_2 of degree 2. We present it via the degrees of maps of various configuration spaces related to a knot to products of spheres. This gives rise to numerous geometrical and combinatorial formulas for this invariant.

entry.title: Automorphisms of the Complex of Curves
entry.summary: This goal of the paper is to show that the automorphisms of the complex of curves in a surface are induced by the self-homeomorphisms of the surface except the surface is the 2-holed torus.

entry.title: Products of Positive Dehn-twists on Surfaces
entry.summary: Given a 3-holed sphere decomposition of an orientable closed surface, it is shown that each orientation preserving homeomorphism of the surface is isotopic to a composition AB where A is a product of positive Dehn twists and B is a product of negative Dehn twists on the decomposition curves.

entry.title: Subspaces of Knot Spaces
entry.summary: The inclusion of the space of all knots of a prescribed writhe in a particular isotopy class into the space of all knots in that isotopy class is a weak homotopy equivalence.

entry.title: Finite Type Invariants of Links with Fixed Linking Matrix
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce two theories of finite type invariants for framed links with fixed linking matrix. We show that these thepries are related to the theory of Vassiliev invariants of framed links. We also study the corresponding spaces of ``chord diagrams''.

entry.title: Bounds on exceptional Dehn filling
entry.summary: We show that for a hyperbolic knot complement, all but at most 12 Dehn fillings are irreducible with infinite word-hyperbolic fundamental group.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published in Geometry and Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/gt/GTVol4/paper15.abs.html

entry.title: Transversal torus knots
entry.summary: We classify positive transversal torus knots in tight contact structures up to transversal isotopy.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages. Published copy, also available at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/gt/GTVol3/paper11.abs.html

entry.title: Constructions of Smooth 4-Manifolds
entry.summary: We describe a collection of constructions which illustrate a panoply of ``exotic'' smooth 4-manifolds.
entry.arxiv:comment: This article appeared in the Proceedings of the 1998 ICM Doc.Math.J.DMV Extra Volume ICM II (1998) 443-452

entry.title: On generalized amenability
entry.summary: There is a word metric $d$ on countably generated free group $\Gamma$ such that $(\Gamma,d)$ does not admit a coarse uniform embedding into a Hilbert space.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, AMSTeX, the version which is merged into a paper "Uniform Embeddings into Hilbert Space..." by D.-Gong-Lafforgue-Yu

entry.title: Quasipositive pretzels
entry.summary: A necessary and sufficient condition for an oriented pretzel surface to be quasipositive yields an estimate for the slice genus of the boundary of an arbitrary oriented pretzel surface.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 8 figures; revised Feb. 22, 2000; to appear in Topology and its Applications

entry.title: Menger (Nobeling) manifolds versus Hilbert cube (space) manifolds - a categorical comparison
entry.summary: We show that the n-homotopy category of connected (n+1)-dimensional Menger manifolds is isomorphic to the homotopy category of connected Hilbert cube manifolds whose k-dimensional homotopy groups are trivial for each k > n.

entry.title: New presentations of surface braid groups
entry.summary: In this paper we give new presentations of the braid groups and the pure braid groups of a closed surface. We also give an algorithm to solve the word problem in these groups, using the given presentations.

entry.title: Proof of the volume conjecture for torus knots
entry.summary: The volume conjecture, formulated recently by H. Murakami and J. Murakami, is proved for the case of torus knots.

entry.title: On [L]-homotopy groups
entry.summary: Some properties of [L]-homotopy group for finite complex L are investigated. It is proved that for complex L whose extension type lying between Sn and Sn+1 n-th [L]-homotopy group of Sn is isomorphic to Z.

entry.title: Cobordism of immersions of surfaces in non-orientable 3-manifolds
entry.summary: Some properties of non-orientable 3-manifolds are shown. The semi-group of cobordism of immersions of surfaces in such manifolds is computed and proven actually to be a group. Explicit invariants are provided.

entry.title: Large characteristic subgroups of surface groups not containing any simple loops
entry.summary: We determine the largest (i.e. smallest index) characteristic subgroup of surface groups not containing any simple loops.

entry.title: Cauchy Inequality and the Space of Measured Laminations
entry.summary: We establish a Cauchy type inequality for the geometric intersection number between two 1-dimensional submanifolds in a surface. Some of the basic results in Thurston's theory of measured laminations on surfaces are derived from the Cauchy inequality.

entry.title: Knots and Contact Geometry
entry.summary: We classify Legendrian torus knots and figure eight knots in the tight contact structure on the 3-sphere up to Legendrian isotopy. As a corollary to this we also obtain the classification of transversal torus knots and figure eight knots up to transversal isotopy.

entry.title: Ordering pure braid groups on closed surfaces
entry.summary: We prove that the pure braid groups on closed, orientable surfaces are bi-orderable, and that the pure braid groups on closed, non-orientable surfaces have generalized torsion, thus they are not bi-orderable.

entry.title: The Combinatorial Gauss Diagram Formula for Kontsevich Integral
entry.summary: In this paper, we shall give an explicit Gauss diagram formula for the Kontsevich integral of links up to degree four. This practical formula enables us to actually compute the Kontsevich integral in a combinatorial way.

entry.title: Faithful Linear Representations of the Braid Groups
entry.summary: We give an exposition of the work of Bigelow and Krammer who proved that the Artin braid groups are linear.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, no pictures. This is the text of my talk at the Bourbaki seminar (Paris, 25.06.2000)

entry.title: Simplifying triangulations of S^3
entry.summary: In this paper we describe a procedure to simplify any given triangulation of the 3-sphere using Pachner moves. We obtain an explicit exponential-type bound on the number of Pachner moves needed for this process. This leads to a new recognition algorithm for the 3-sphere.

entry.title: A note on the Legendrian isotopy problem
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due to a mistake pointed out by Lenny Ng and Josh Sabloff.
entry.arxiv:comment: this paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Hyperbolic Dehn surgery on geometrically infinite 3-manifolds
entry.summary: In this paper we extend Thurston's hyperbolic Dehn surgery theorem to a class of geometrically infinite hyperbolic 3-manifolds. As an application we prove a modest density theorem for Kleinian groups. We also discuss hyperbolic Dehn surgery on geometrically finite hypebolic cone-manifolds.

entry.title: On the uniqueness conjecture for Markoff triples
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by author due to an error in the proof.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by author due to an error in the proof

entry.title: Positive knots and knots with braid index three have property_p
entry.summary: We prove that positive knots and knots with braid index three in the 3-sphere satisfy the Property P conjecture.

entry.title: The Kauffman bracket skein as an algebra of observables
entry.summary: We prove that the Kauffman bracket skein algebra of a cylinder over a surface with boundary, defined over complex numbers, is isomorphic to the observables of an appropriate lattice gauge field theory.

entry.title: The classification of exceptional Dehn surgeries on 2-bridge knots
entry.summary: We will classify all exceptional Dehn surgeries on 2-bridge knots according to whether they produce reducible, toroidal, or small Seifert fibered manifolds.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 9 figures. To appear in Comm. Anal. Geom

entry.title: Compressing totally geodesic surfaces
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that one can find surgeries arbitrarily close to infinity in the Dehn surgery space of the figure eight knot complement for which some immersed totally geodesic surface compresses.

entry.title: Symmetry of links and classification of lens spaces
entry.summary: We give a concise proof of a classification of lens spaces up to orientation-preserving homeomorphisms. The chief ingredient in our proof is a study of the Alexander polynomial of ` symmetric' links in $S^3$.

entry.title: Surgery formula for torsions and Seiberg-Witten invariants of 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We give a surgery formula for the torsions and Seiberg-Witten invariants associated with $Spin^c$-structures on 3-manifolds. We use the technique of Reidemeister-type torsions and their refinements.

entry.title: Convex decomposition theory
entry.summary: We use convex decomposition theory to (1) reprove the existence of a universally tight contact structure on every irreducible 3-manifold with nonempty boundary, and (2) prove that every toroidal 3-manifold carries infinitely many nonisotopic, nonisomorphic tight contact structures.

entry.title: Analytic invariants of boundary links
entry.summary: Using basic topology and linear algebra, we define a plethora of invariants of boundary links whose values are power series with noncommuting variables. These turn out to be useful and elementary reformulations of an invariant originally defined by M. Farber.

entry.title: Seiberg-Witten invariants of rational homology spheres
entry.summary: We prove that the Seiberg-Witten invariants of a rational homology sphere are determined in a very explicit fashion by the Casson-Walker invariant and the Reidemeister torsion

entry.title: On the first two Vassiliev invariants
entry.summary: The values that the first two Vassiliev invariants take on prime knots with up to fourteen crossings are considered. This leads to interesting fish-like graphs. Several results about the values taken on torus knots are proved.

entry.title: Injectivity Radius and Fundamental Group of Hyperbolic 3-Manifolds
entry.summary: We show that there is an upper bound on the injectivity radius of a hyperbolic 3-manifold in terms of the the number of generators of its fundamental group.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 7 figures, to appeat in Communications in Analysis and Geometry

entry.title: A diameter bound for closed, hyperbolic 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We show there is an upper bound on the diameter of a closed, hyperbolic 3-manifold in terms of the length of any presentation of its fundamental group.

entry.title: A non-ribbon plumbing of fibered ribbon knots
entry.summary: A closer look at an example introduced by Livingston & Melvin and later studied by Miyazaki shows that a plumbing of two fibered ribbon knots (along their fiber surfaces) may be algebraically slice yet not ribbon.

entry.title: Branched covers of tangles in three-balls
entry.summary: We give an algorithm for a surgery description of a $p$-fold cyclic branched cover of $B^3$ branched along a tangle. We generalize constructions of Montesinos and Akbulut-Kirby.

entry.title: p-Modular TQFT's and Torsion
entry.summary: We give an overview over several constructions of TQFT's over finite fields and cyclotomic integers and their applications to characterizing 3-manifolds and their fundamental groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: Slides of talk presented at the RIMS workshop "Invariants of knots and 3-manifolds". 20 pages, 8 figures

entry.title: On periodic homeomorphisms of spheres
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to study how small orbits of periodic homemorphisms of spheres can be.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Algebraic and Geometric Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/agt/AGTVol1/agt-1-22.abs.html

entry.title: Thinning genus two Heegaard spines in the 3-sphere
entry.summary: We study trivalent graphs in $S^{3}$ whose closed complement is a genus two handlebody. We show that such a graph, when put in thin position, has a simple (i. e. non-loop) level edge.

entry.title: On the Gabai-Eliashberg-Thurston theorem
entry.summary: We present a new, completely three-dimensional proof of the fact, due to Gabai-Eliashberg-Thurston, that every closed, oriented, irreducible 3-manifold with nonzero second homology carries a universally tight contact structure.

entry.title: The support of the Khovanov's invariants for alternating knots
entry.summary: In this article, we prove the conjecture of Bar-Natan, Garoufalidis, and Khovanov's on the support of the Khovanov's invariants for alternating knots.

entry.title: Variations on Fintushel-Stern Knot Surgery on 4-manifolds
entry.summary: We discuss some consequences Fintushel-Stern `knot surgery' operation on 4-manifolds coming from its handlebody description. We give some generalizations of this operation and give a counterexample to their conjecture.

entry.title: Immersed projective planes, Arf invariants and even 4-manifolds
entry.summary: In this paper, we exploit a subtle indeterminacy in the definition of the spherical Kervaire-Milnor invariant which was discovered by R. Stong to construct non-spin 4-manifolds with even intersection form and prescribed signature.

entry.title: Alexander polynomials of equivariant slice and ribbon knots in S^3
entry.summary: This paper gives an algebraic characterization of Alexander polynomials of equivariant ribbon knots and a factorization condition satisfied by Alexander polynomials of equivariant slice knots.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Transactions of the American Mathematical Society, 358 (2005), 2949-2964

entry.title: Lectures on controlled topology: mapping cylinder neighborhoods
entry.summary: The existence theorem for mapping cylinder neighborhoods is discussed as a prototypical example of controlled topology and its applications. The first of a projected series developed from lectures at the Summer School on High-Dimensional Topology, Trieste Italy 2001

entry.title: An algorithm to detect laminar 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We show that there are algorithms to determine if a 3-manifold contains an essential lamination or a Reebless foliation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Geometry and Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/gt/GTVol7/paper8.abs.html

entry.title: All flat manifolds are cusps of hyperbolic orbifolds
entry.summary: We show that all closed flat n-manifolds are diffeomorphic to a cusp cross-section in a finite volume hyperbolic (n+1)-orbifold.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Algebraic and Geometric Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/agt/AGTVol2/agt-2-13.abs.html

entry.title: Fiber sums of genus 2 Lefschetz fibrations
entry.summary: Using the recent results of Siebert and Tian about the holomorphicity of genus 2 Lefschetz fibrations with irreducible singular fibers, we show that any genus 2 Lefschetz fibration becomes holomorphic after fiber sum with a holomorphic fibration.

entry.title: A Smooth Compactification of the Moduli Space of Instantons and Its Application
entry.summary: A smooth compactification of Donaldson moduli spaces is given. As an application, we use this new space to study the wall-crossing formula and prove the Kotschick-Morgan conjecture.

entry.title: Small 3-manifolds of large genus
entry.summary: We prove the existence of pure braids with arbitrarily many strands which are small, i.e. they contain no closed incompressible surface in the complement which is not boundary parallel. This implies the existence of irreducible non-Haken 3-manifolds of arbitrarily high Heegaard genus.

entry.title: Diagrams of divide links
entry.summary: Recently N.A'Campo suggested a construction of a link from a generic immersion of a curve into a 2-disk. It is tightly related to the singularity theory. In this paper, we give a simple procedure to draw a diagram of the link from a picture of the curve.

entry.title: Minimal spheres of arbitrarily high Morse index
entry.summary: We construct a smooth Riemannian metric on any 3-manifold with the property that there are genus zero embedded minimal surfaces of arbitrarily high Morse index.

entry.title: Crosscap numbers of torus knots
