entry.summary: The crosscap number of a knot in the 3-sphere is the minimal genus of non-orientable surface bounded by the knot. We determine the crosscap numbers of torus knots.

entry.title: A homological estimate for the Thurston norm
entry.summary: We establish a new homological lower bound for the Thurston norm on 1-cohomology of 3-manifolds. This generalizes previous results of C. McMullen, S. Harvey, and the author. We also establish an analogous lower bound for 1-cohomology of 2-dimensional CW-complexes.

entry.title: Strongly irreducible surface automorphisms
entry.summary: A surface automorphism is strongly irreducible if every essential simple closed curve in the surface has nontrivial geometric intersection with its image. We show that a three-manifold admits only finitely many inequivalent surface bundle structures with strongly irreducible monodromy.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 6 figures. To appear in the proceedings of the Georgia Topology Conference

entry.title: An algorithm to find vertical tori in small Seifert fiber spaces
entry.summary: We give an algorithm to find vertical essential tori in small Seifert fiber spaces with infinite fundamental groups. This implies that there are algorithms to decide whether a 3-manifold is a Seifert fiber space.

entry.title: Casson invariant of knots associated with divides
entry.summary: I present a formula for the Casson invariant of knots associated with divides. The formula is written in terms of Arnold's invariants of pieces of the divide. Various corollaries are discussed.

entry.title: Universal spaces for asymptotic dimension
entry.summary: We construct a universal space for the class of proper metric spaces of bounded geometry and of given asymptotic dimension. As a consequence of this result, we establish coincidence of the asymptotic dimension with the asymptotic inductive dimensions.

entry.title: A compact group action which raises dimension to infinity
entry.summary: I give a construction of compact group action on a finite dimensional space Y, whose orbit space is infinite dimensional.

entry.title: Foliations with unbounded deviation on the two-dimensional torus
entry.summary: There exists a smooth foliation with 3 singular points on the two-dimensional torus such that any lifting of a leaf of this foliation on the universal covering of the torus is a dense subset of the covering.

entry.title: Elimination of singularities of smooth mappings of 4-manifolds into 3-manifolds
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn. Its new version has been published.

entry.title: Khovanov Homology and Conway Mutation
entry.summary: We present an easy example of mutant links with different Khovanov homology. The existence of such an example is important because it shows that Khovanov homology cannot be defined with a skein rule similar to the skein relation for the Jones polynomial.

entry.title: The Dehn filling space of a certain hyperbolic 3-orbifold
entry.summary: We construct the first example of a ``one-cusped'' hyperbolic 3-orbifold for which we see the true shape of the space of hyperbolic Dehn fillings.

entry.title: Invariants of Legendrian knots
entry.summary: We present two different constructions of invariants for Legendrian knots in the standard contact space $\R^3$. These invariants are defined combinatorially, in terms of certain planar projections, and are useful in distinguishing Legendrian knots that have the same classical invariants but are not Legendrian isotopic.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 2, 385--394

entry.title: Notes on the isotopy finiteness
entry.summary: This is the less official, English version of the proof of the fact that every closed atoroidal 3-manifold carries finitely many isotopy classes of tight contact structures.

entry.title: Concordance of boundary links
entry.summary: We show that the twisted signature invariants of boundary link concordance derived from unitary representations of the free group are actually ordinary link concordance invariants. We also show how the discontinuity locus of this signature function is determined by Seifert matrices of the link.

entry.title: Torus knots and Dunwoody manifolds
entry.summary: We obtain an explicit representation, as Dunwoody manifolds, of all cyclic branched coverings of torus knots of type $(p,mp\pm 1)$, with $p>1$ and $m>0$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 7 figures, to appear in the Siberian Mathematical Journal

entry.title: Incompressible maps of surfaces and Dehn filling
entry.summary: We prove results showing that the existence of essential maps of surfaces in a manifold M' obtained from a 3-manifold M by Dehn filling implies the existence of essential maps of surfaces in M.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, 13 figures. To appear Topology and its Applications

entry.title: Gauss diagrams of 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We present a simple combinatorial method to encode 3-dimensional manifolds, based on their Heegaard diagrams. The notion of a Gauss diagram of a 3-manifold is introduced. We check the conditions for a Gauss diagram to represent a closed manifold and a manifold with boundary.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, 19 figures; to appear in JKTR

entry.title: Rational homology spheres and four-ball genus
entry.summary: Using the Heegaard Floer homology of Ozsvath and Szabo we investigate obstructions to definite intersection pairings bounded by rational homology spheres. As an application we obtain new lower bounds for the four-ball genus of Montesinos links.

entry.title: Thin position in the theory of classical knots
entry.summary: This is a chapter that is to appear in the "Handbook of Knot Theory", edited by William W. Menasco and Morwen B. Thistlethwaite.
entry.arxiv:comment: 33pp. 12 fig. A mildly updated version for final pubication

entry.title: Existence theorems of fold-maps
entry.summary: A smooth map having only fold singularities is called a fold-map. We will give effective conditions for a continuous map to be homotopic to a fold-map from the viewpoint of the homotopy principle.

entry.title: Closed geodesics on incomplete surfaces
entry.summary: We consider the problem of finding embedded closed geodesics on the two-sphere with an incomplete metric defined outside a point. Various techniques including curve shortening methods are used.

entry.title: Legendrian Vertical Circles in Small Seifert Spaces
entry.summary: We discuss the relations between the $e_0$ invariants of a small Seifert space and the twisting numbers of Legendrian vertical circles in it.

entry.title: A cabling formula for the 2-loop polynomial of knots
entry.summary: The 2-loop polynomial is a polynomial presenting the 2-loop part of the Kontsevich invariant of knots. We show a cabling formula for the 2-loop polynomial of knots. In particular, we calculate the 2-loop polynomial for torus knots.

entry.title: Virtual strings
entry.summary: A virtual string is a scheme of self-intersections of a closed curve on a surface. We introduce virtual strings and study their geometric properties and homotopy invariants. We also discuss connections between virtual strings, Gauss words, and virtual knots.

entry.title: Problems on homology manifolds
entry.summary: A list of problems prepared for the proceedings of the Workshop on Exotic Homology Manifolds, Oberwolfach June 29-July 5 2003.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is the version published by Geometry & Topology Monographs on 22 April 2006

entry.title: Triangulated Manifolds with Few Vertices: Geometric 3-Manifolds
entry.summary: We explicitly construct small triangulations for a number of well-known 3-dimensional manifolds and give a brief outline of some aspects of the underlying theory of 3-manifolds and its historical development.

entry.title: TQFT computations and experiments
entry.summary: With the help of a new program, we do computations concerning the Witten-Reshetikhin-Turaev representations of mapping class groups. In particular we distinguish some mutant fibered knots. The program can be downloaded from http://www.geometrie.ch/TQFT

entry.title: A Surgery Theory for Manifolds of Bounded Geometry
entry.summary: A surgery classification theory is introduced for manifolds of bounded geometry up to quasi-isometry. The Borel conjecture for this theory is proven for flat Euclidean space.

entry.title: All frame-spun knots are slice
entry.summary: Frame-spun knots are constructed by spinning a knot of lower dimension about a framed submanifold of S^n. We show that all frame-spun knots are slice (null-cobordant).
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages; to appear in Proc. Amer. Math. Soc.; see also http://www.math.yale.edu/~friedman

entry.title: Framings and Projective Framings for 3-Manifolds
entry.summary: We give an elementary proof of the fact that any orientable 3-manifold admits a framing (i.e. is parallelizable) and any non-orientable 3-manifold admits a projective framing. The proof uses only basic facts about immersions of surfaces in 3-space.

entry.title: Counterexamples of the Geometrization Conjecture
entry.summary: In this paper we propose counterexamples to the Geometrization Conjecture and the Elliptization Conjecture.

entry.title: Some examples of aspherical 4-manifolds that are homology 4-spheres
entry.summary: In this paper, Problem 4.17 on R. Kirby's problem list is solved by constructing infinitely many aspherical 4-manifolds that are homology 4-spheres

entry.title: Algebraic formulas whose structure imitates Pachner moves and new types of acyclic complexes
entry.summary: What discuss the problem of obtaining new manifold invariants via different analogues of 6j-symbols and the torsion of acyclic complexes.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Topology Atlas Invited Contributions vol. 7 issue 1 (2002) p. 1-3

entry.title: Hyperbolic cone-manifolds with large cone-angles
entry.summary: We prove that every closed oriented 3-manifold admits a hyperbolic cone-manifold structure with cone-angle arbitrarily close to 2pi.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Geometry and Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/gt/GTVol7/paper24.abs.html

entry.title: Equivariant Cohomological Chern Characters
entry.summary: We construct for an equivariant cohomology theory for proper equivariant CW-complexes an equivariant Chern character, provided that certain conditions about the coefficients are satisfied. These conditions are fulfilled if the coefficients of the equivariant cohomology theory possess a Mackey structure. Such a structure is present in many interesting examples.

entry.title: The colored Jones polynomial and the A-polynomial for twist knots
entry.summary: We show that for a twist knot, the A-polynomial can be obtained from recurrences for the summand in Masbaum's formula of the colored Jones polynomial. Our result supports the AJ conjecture due to S.Garoufalidis.

entry.title: Linear Legendrian curves in $T^3$
entry.summary: Using convex surfaces and Kanda's classification theorem, we classify Legendrian isotopy classes of Legendrian linear curves in all tight contact structures on $T^3$. Some of the knot types considered in this article provide new examples of non transversally simple knot types.

entry.title: Tight Contact Small Seifert Spaces with $e_0\neq0,-1,-2$
entry.summary: We classify up to isotopy the tight contact structures on small Seifert spaces with $e_0\neq0,-1,-2$. (The first version contains on the $e_0<-2$ case.)

entry.title: Length series on Teichmuller space
entry.summary: We prove that a certain series defines a constant function using Wolpert's formula for the variation of the length of a geodesic along a Fenchel Nielsen twist. Subsequently we determine the value viewing it as function on the the Deligne Mumford compactification and evaluating it at the stable curve at infinity.

entry.title: The kernel of $Burau(4) \otimes Z_p$ is all pseudo-Anosov
entry.summary: We show that the kernel of $Burau(4) \otimes Z_p$, the reduced Burau representation with coefficients in $Z_p$ of the 4-braid group $B_4$, consists only of pseudo-Anosov braids.

entry.title: Real Valued Dimension For Morse-Sard Theorem
entry.summary: A dimension allowing in particular to state necessary and sufficient conditions of the Morse-Sard Theorem for real valued functions is introduced.

entry.title: Vector valued functions not constant on connected sets of critical points
entry.summary: Whitney type examples of maps $f\in C^k(\real^m,\real^n)$ for a maximal possible real $k$, and multidimensional space-filling curves with special properties are constructed.

entry.title: Absolute extensors in extension theory
entry.summary: Let L be a countable and locally finite CW complex. Suppose that the class of all metrizable compacta of extension dimension not greater than L contains a universal element which is an absolute extensor in dimension L. Our main result shows that L is quasi-finite.

entry.title: A quasifibration of spaces of positive scalar curvature metrics
entry.summary: In this paper we show that for Riemannian manifolds with boundary the natural restriction map is a quasifibration between spaces of metrics of positive scalar curvature. We apply this result to study homotopy properties of spaces of such metrics on manifolds with boundary.

entry.title: Thurston's bending measure conjecture for once punctured torus groups
entry.summary: We prove Thurston's bending measure conjecture for quasifuchsian once punctured torus groups. The conjecture states that the bending measures of the two components of the convex hull boundary uniquely determine the group.

entry.title: The Conway potential function of a graph link
entry.summary: We give a closed formula for the multivariable Conway potential function of any graph link in a homology sphere. As corollaries, we answer three questions by Walter Neumann about graph links.

entry.title: Transcendental ending laminations
entry.summary:
Yair Minsky showed that punctured torus groups are classified by a pair of ending laminations (
u_-,
u_+). In this note, we show that there are ending laminations 
u_+ such that for any choice of 
u_-, the punctured torus group is transcendental as a subgroup of PSL_2 C.

entry.title: Sphere recognition lies in NP
entry.summary: We prove that the three-sphere recognition problem lies in the complexity class NP. Our work relies on Thompson's original proof that the problem is decidable [Math. Res. Let., 1994], Casson's version of her algorithm, and recent results of Agol, Hass, and Thurston [ArXiv, 2002].

entry.title: The Conway function of a splice
entry.summary: We give a closed formula for the Conway function of a splice in terms of the Conway function of its splice components. As corollaries, we refine and generalize results of Seifert, Torres, and Sumners-Woods.

entry.title: A search method for thin positions of links
entry.summary: We give a method for searching for thin positions of a given link.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Algebraic and Geometric Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/agt/AGTVol5/agt-5-42.abs.html

entry.title: Embedded Surfaces in the 3-Torus
entry.summary: Those maps of a closed surface to the three-dimensional torus that are homotopic to embeddings are characterized. Particular attention is paid to the somewhat intricate case when the surface is nonorientable.

entry.title: Stabilizations of Reducible Heegaard Splittings
entry.summary: C. Gordon conjectured that a connected sum of two Heegaard splittings is stabilized if and only if one of the two factors is stabilized (Problem 3.91 in Kirby's problem list). In this paper, we shall prove this conjecture.

entry.title: Poincare duality in dimension 3
entry.summary: The paper gives a review of progress towards extending the Thurston programme to the Poincare duality case. For a full abstract, see the published version at the above link.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Geometry and Topology Monographs at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/gt/GTMon7/paper1.abs.html

entry.title: Integral non-hyperbolike surgeries
entry.summary: It is shown that a hyperbolic knot in the 3-sphere admits at most nine integral surgeries yielding 3-manifolds which are reducible or whose fundamental groups are not infinite word-hyperbolic.

entry.title: Filtration of Heegaard Floer homology and gluing formulas
entry.summary: We introduce an extra filtration of $\CFK(Y,K)$ and use it in order to obtain formulas for Floer homology of $(Y,K)$, which is obtained from $(Y_i,K_i), i=1,2$ by gluing the knot complements on the framed torus boundaries.

entry.title: Noncongruence subgroups in H(2)
entry.summary: We study the congruence problem for subgroups of the modular group that appear as Veech groups of square-tiled surfaces in the minimal stratum of abelian differentials of genus two.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted for publication in International Mathematics Research Notices

entry.title: Totally Geodesic Seifert Surfaces in Hyperbolic Knot and Link Complements I
entry.summary: The first examples of totally geodesic Seifert surfaces are constructed for hyperbolic knots and links, including both free and totally knotted surfaces. Then it is proved that two bridge knot complements cannot contain totally geodesic orientable surfaces.

entry.title: On Park's exotic smooth four-manifolds
entry.summary: In a recent paper, Park constructs certain exotic simply-connected four-manifolds with small Euler characteristics. Our aim here is to prove that the four-manifolds in his constructions are minimal.

entry.title: A characterization of quasipositive Seifert surfaces (Constructions of quasipositive knots and links, III)
entry.summary: This article was originally published in Topology 31 (1992). The present hyperTeXed redaction corrects a few typographical errors and updates the references.

entry.title: Continuity of the Volume of Simplices in Classical Geometry
entry.summary: It is proved that the volume of spherical or hyperbolic simplices, when considered as a function of the dihedral angles, can be extended continuously to degenerated simplices.

entry.title: Reidemeister torsion of a symplcetic complex
entry.summary: We consider a claim mentioned in \cite{Witten} pp 187 about the relation between a symplectic chain complex with $\omega-$compatible bases and Reidemeister Torsion of it. This is an explanation of it.

entry.title: A Torres condition for twisted Alexander polynomials
entry.summary: As a generalization of a fundamental result about the Alexander polynomial of links, we give a description of a Torres condition for the twisted Alexander polynomial of links associated to a unimodular representation.

entry.title: On Finite Racks and Quandles
entry.summary: We revisit finite racks and quandles using a perspective based on permutations which can aid in the understanding of the structure. As a consequence we recover old results and prove new ones. We also present and analyze several examples.
entry.arxiv:comment: submitted to Comm. Algebra in September 2004

entry.title: Brunnian local moves of knots and Vassiliev invariants
entry.summary: K. Habiro gave a neccesary and sufficient condition for knots to have the same Vassiliev invariants in terms of $C_k$-move. In this paper we give another geometric condition in terms of Brunnian local move. The proof is simple and self-contained.

entry.title: The Khovanov Complex for Virtual Links
entry.summary: In the present paper, we construct the Khovanov homology theory for virtual links. Besides the direct approach with Z_{2} coefficients we also describe the Khovanov homology for framed links and the Khovanov homology using ``double cover''. The latter two approaches are based on the notion of ``atom''.

entry.title: Minimal diagrams of classical and virtual links
entry.summary: We prove that a virtual link diagrams satisfying two conditions on the Khovanov homology is minimal, that is, there is no virtual diagram representing the same link with smaller number of crossings. This approach works for both classical and virtual links

entry.title: Minimal diagrams of virtual links: II
entry.summary: In the present paper we bring together minimality conditions proposed in previous two papers and present some new minimality conditions for classical and virtual knots and links.

entry.title: Thick surfaces in hyperbolic 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We show that every closed, virtually fibered hyperbolic 3-manifold contains immersed, quasi-Fuchsian surfaces with convex cores of arbitrarily large thickness.
entry.arxiv:comment: Minor changes and expanded exposition. To appear in Geom. Dedicata

entry.title: Bar-Natan's Khovanov homology for coloured links
entry.summary: Using Bar-Natan's Khovanov homology we define a homology theory for coloured, oriented, framed links. We then compute this explicitly.

entry.title: Circle bundles over 4-manifolds
entry.summary: Every 1-connected topological 4-manifold M admits a $S^{1}$-covering by $#_{r-1}S^{2}\times S^{3}$, where $r=$rank$H^{2}(M;\QTR{Bbb}{Z})$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages to appear in Archiv der Math

entry.title: Pseudo-conformal quaternionic CR structure on (4n+3)-dimensional manifolds
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to introduce a geometric structure called pseudo-conformal quaternionic CR structure on a (4n+3)-dimensional mamnifold and then exhibit a quaternionic analogue of Chern-Moser's CR structure and uniformization.

entry.title: Comportement à l'infini du graphe gordien des nœuds
entry.summary: We study the gordian graph of all knots in $\R^3$: two knots are adjacent if they differ by a single crossing change. We prove that this graph contains isometrically an infinite countable tree with infinite valency, and that the complement of any finite subset is connected.

entry.title: On Some Aspects of 4-Dimensional Topology: A Popular Survey
entry.summary: The general structure of the paper should be remaid. Hence author removed this paper from arXiv.
entry.arxiv:comment: The general structure of the paper should be remaid. Hence author removed this paper from arXiv

entry.title: Knot polynomials and knot homologies
entry.summary: This is an expository paper discussing some parallels between the Khovanov and knot Floer homologies. We describe the formal similarities between the theories and give some examples which illustrate a somewhat mysterious correspondence between them.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages. To appear in proceedings of the Fields Institute/McMaster Conference on Geometry and Topology of Manifolds

entry.title: The Novikov conjecture for mapping class groups as a corollary of Hamenstadt's theorem
entry.summary: This short note shows how the Novikov conjecture for mapping class groups follows from a theorem of Kato and a result theorem of Hamenstadt.

entry.title: Crosscap numbers of 2-bridge knots
entry.summary: We present a practical algorithm to determine the minimal genus of non-orientable spanning surfaces for 2-bridge knots, called the crosscap numbers. We will exhibit a table of crosscap numbers of 2-bridge knots up to 12crossings (all 362 of them).

entry.title: Braid Family Representatives
entry.summary: After defining reduced minimum braid word and criteria for a braid family representative, different braid family representatives are derived, and a correspondence between them and families of knots and links given in Conway notation is established.

entry.title: On the Slicing Genus of Legendrian Knots
entry.summary: We apply Heegaard-Floer homology theory to establish generalized slicing Bennequin inequalities closely related to a recent result of T. Mrowka and Y. Rollin proved using Seiberg-Witten monopoles.

entry.title: Capacity dimension and embedding of hyperbolic spaces into the product of trees
entry.summary: We prove that every visual Gromov hyperbolic space X whose boundary at infinity has the finite capacity dimension n admits a quasi-isometric embedding into (n+1)-fold product of metric trees.

entry.title: The renormalized Euler Characteristic and L-space surgeries
entry.summary: Using the equivalence between the renormalized Euler characteristic of Ozsvath and Szabo, and the Turaev torsion normalized by the Casson-Walker invariant, we make calculations for $S^3_{p/q}(K)$. An alternative proof of a theorem by Ozsv\'ath and Szab\'o on $L$-space surgery obstructions is provided.

entry.title: Strongly fillable contact 3-manifolds without Stein fillings
entry.summary: We use the Ozsvath-Szabo contact invariant to produce examples of strongly symplectically fillable contact 3-manifolds which are not Stein fillable.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Geometry and Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/gt/GTVol9/paper38.abs.html

entry.title: Knots and words
entry.summary: Knots and links are interpreted as homotopy classes of nanowords and nanophrases in an alphabet consisting of 4 letters. Similar results hold for curves on surfaces. We also discuss versions of the Jones link polynomial and the link quandles for nanophrases.

entry.title: The Group of Contactomorphisms of the Sphere Fixing an Overtwisted Disk
entry.summary: We calculate the weak homotopy type of the group of contactomorphisms of the three-sphere which coincide with the identity on (a neighborhood of) an overtwisted disk.

entry.title: Surgery Description of Orientation-Preserving $D_{2p}$-Actions on Compact Orientable 3-Manifolds
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because its contents have become subsumed in Section 5.2 of arXiv:0805.2307.

entry.title: Braid Groups of the Sun Graph
entry.summary: In this article we calculate the n-string braid groups of certain non-contractible graphs. We use techniques from the work of A. Abrams, F. Connolly and M. Doig combined with Van Kampen's Theorem to prove these results.

entry.title: The Harmonic Volumes of Hyperelliptic Curves
entry.summary: We determine the harmonic volumes for all the hyperelliptic curves. This gives a geometric interpretation of a theorem established by A. Tanaka.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, 4 figures, to appear in Publ. RIMS, Kyoto University

entry.title: Characterizing metric spaces whose hyperspaces are absolute neighborhood retracts
entry.summary: We characterize metric spaces $X$ whose hyperspaces $2^X$ or $Bd(X)$ of non-empty closed (bounded) subsets, endowed with the Hausdorff metric, are absolute [neighborhood] retracts.

entry.title: Kleinian groups with discrete length spectrum
entry.summary: We characterize finitely generated torsion-free Kleinian groups for which the real length spectrum (without multiplicities) is discrete.

entry.title: The extended mapping class group is generated by three symmetries
entry.summary: We prove that the extended mapping class group is generated by three orientation reversing involutions.
entry.arxiv:comment: A version of the article which appeared in C. R. Acad. Sci

entry.title: Replacing a graph clasper by tree claspers
entry.summary: We prove that two links related by a surgery along a connected, strict graph clasper of degree n are C_n-equivalent, i.e, related by a sequence of surgeries along strict tree claspers of degree n.

entry.title: A Z-set unknotting theorem for Nobeling spaces
entry.summary: We prove a $Z$-set unknotting theorem for Nobeling spaces. This generalizes a result obtained by S. Ageev for a restricted class of $Z$-sets. The theorem is proved for a certain model of Nobeling spaces.

entry.title: Teichmuller geodesics that do not have a limit in PMF
entry.summary: We construct a Teichmuller geodesic which does not have a limit on the Thurston boundary of the Teichmuller space.

entry.title: The pointed harmonic volumes of hyperelliptic curves with Weierstrass base points
entry.summary: We give a explicit computation of the pointed harmonic volumes of hyperelliptic curves with Weierstrass base points, which are paraphrased into a combinatorial formula.

entry.title: The Aarhus integral and the mu-invariants
entry.summary: We relate the tree part of the Aarhus integral to Milnor's mu-invariants of string-links in homology balls thus generalizing results of Habegger and Masbaum.
entry.arxiv:comment: accepted for publication by Journal of Knot Theory and its Ramifications

entry.title: Surfaces in 4-manifolds: Addendum
entry.summary: In this note we fill a gap in the proof of the main theorem (Theorem 1.2) of our paper 'Surfaces in 4-manifolds', Math. Res. Letters 4 (1997), 907-914.

entry.title: Lower central series for surface braid groups
entry.summary: We determine the lower central series and corresponding residual properties for braid groups and pure braid groups of orientable surfaces.

entry.title: Holomorphic disks and link invariants
entry.summary: We define a Floer-homology invariant for links in $S^3$, and study its properties.

entry.title: A short proof of Bing's characterization of$S^3$
entry.summary: We give a short proof of Bing's characterization of $S^3$: a compact, connected 3-manifold $M$ is $S^3$ if and only if every knot in $M$ is isotopic into a ball.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Proceedings of the AMS, 2 pages

entry.title: Real algebraic structures
entry.summary: A brief survey of real algebraic structures on topological spaces is given. This article is written for the Gokova Gemetry/Topology Conference proceedings.

entry.title: Products of open manifolds with R
entry.summary: In this note we present a characterization of those open n-manifolds (n>4), whose products with the real line are homeomorphic to interiors of compact (n+1)-manifolds with boundary.

entry.title: Totally geodesic surfaces and homology
entry.summary: We construct examples of hyperbolic rational homology spheres and hyperbolic knot complements in rational homology spheres containing closed embedded totally geodesic surfaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is the version published by Algebraic & Geometric Topology on 25 September 2006

entry.title: Examples of symplectic 4-manifolds with positive signature
entry.summary: We construct a new family {K_n} of simply connected symplectic 4-manifolds with the property c_1^2(K_n)/chi(K_n) -> 9 (as n goes to infinity).
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Geometry and topology of manifolds, 235-242, Fields Inst. Commun., 47 (2005)

entry.title: Seifert matrices of Brunnian links
entry.summary: We show some properties of a Seifert matrix of an $n$-component Brunnian link. In particular, we give a necessary and sufficient condition for a matrix to be a Seifert matrix of a 2-component Brunnian link up to S-equivalence.

entry.title: Characterizing Nobeling spaces
entry.summary: It is shown that Nobeling spaces are uniquely determined by the universal extension and embedding properties.
entry.arxiv:comment: added a footnote regarding A. Nagorko's Ph.D. thesis

entry.title: Two-sided asymptotic bounds for the complexity of some closed hyperbolic three-manifolds
entry.summary: We establish two-sided bounds for the complexity of two infinite series of closed orientable 3-dimensional hyperbolic manifolds, the Lobell manifolds and the Fibonacci manifolds.

entry.title: Hyperbolic isometries versus symmetries of links
entry.summary: We prove that every finite group is the orientation-preserving isometry group of the complement of a hyperbolic link in the 3-sphere.
entry.arxiv:comment: Only the footnote for the funding institutions have been modified

entry.title: A new property of the Alexander polynomial
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn because the result turns out to be trivial.

entry.title: The Hawaiian earring group and metrizability
entry.summary: Endowed with quotient topology inherited from the space of based loops, the fundamental group of the Hawaiian earring fails to be metrizable. The fundamental group of any space which retracts to the Hawaiian earring is also nonmetrizable.

entry.title: Knots with infinitely many incompressible Seifert surfaces
entry.summary: We show that a knot in $S^3$ with an infinite number of distinct incompressible Seifert surfaces contains a closed incompressible surface in its complement.

entry.title: Automatic continuity in homeomorphism groups of compact 2-manifolds
entry.summary: We show that any homomorphism from the homeomorphism group of a compact 2-manifold, with the compact-open topology, or equivalently, with the topology of uniform convergence, into a separable topological group is automatically continuous.

entry.title: Link Floer homology detects the Thurston norm
entry.summary: We prove that, for a link $L$ in a rational homology 3--sphere, the link Floer homology detects the Thurston norm of its complement. This generalizes the previous results due to Ozsv\'ath, Szab\'o and the author.

entry.title: Lifting finite groups of outer automorphisms of free groups, surface groups and their abelianizations
entry.summary: We discuss the possibility of lifting finite subgroups, and in particular finite cyclic subgroups, with respect to the canonical projections between automorphism and outer automorphism groups of free groups, surface groups and their abelianizations.

entry.title: Explicit horizontal open books on some Seifert fibered 3--manifolds
entry.summary: We describe explicit horizontal open books on some Seifert fibered 3--manifolds. We show that the contact structures compatible with these horizontal open books are Stein fillable and horizontal as well. Moreover we draw surgery diagrams for some of these contact structures.

entry.title: A spherical decomposition for Riemannian open 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We show that open 3-manifolds that have a locally finite decomposition along 2-spheres are characterized by the existence of a Riemannian metric with respect to which the second homotopy group of the manifold is generated by small elements.

entry.title: Comparing Singular Homology with respect to Isometry
entry.summary: This article was withdrawn by the arXiv.org administrators since it plagiarizes math.AT/0401211.
entry.arxiv:comment: This article was withdrawn by the arXiv.org administrators since it plagiarizes math.AT/0401211

entry.title: 5-moves and Montesinos links
entry.summary: We classify the Montesinos links up to mutation and 5-move equivalence, and obtain from this a Jones and Kauffman polynomial test for a Montesinos link.

entry.title: Two-generator Kleinian orbifolds
entry.summary: We give a complete list of orbifolds uniformised by discrete non-elementary two-generator subgroups of PSL(2,C) without invariant plane whose generators and their commutator have real traces.

entry.title: Classifying links under fused isotopy
entry.summary: All knots are fused isotopic to the unknot via a process known as virtualization. We extend and adapt this process to show that, up to fused isotopy, classical links are classified by their linking numbers.

entry.title: A spectral sequence for Khovanov homology with an application to (3,q)-torus links
entry.summary: A spectral sequence converging to Khovanov homology is constructed which is applied to calculate the rational Khovanov homology of (3,q)-torus links.

entry.title: On colored quandle longitudes and its applications to tangle embeddings and virtual knots
entry.summary: We define new invariants of knots by means of quandle colorings and longitudinal information. These invariants can be applied to a tangle embedding problem and recognizing non-classical virtual knots.

entry.title: Cusps of arithmetic orbifolds
entry.summary: This thesis investigates cusp cross-sections of arithmetic real, complex, and quaternionic hyperbolic $n$--orbifolds. We give a smooth classification of these submanifolds and analyze their induced geometry. One of the primary tools is a new subgroup separability result for general arithmetic lattices.

entry.title: An algorithm to compute some Heegaard Floer homologies
entry.summary: The earlier article tried to construct an algorithm to compute the Heegaard Floer homology \hat{HF}(Y) for a 3-manifold Y. However there is an error in a proof which the author, as of now, is unable to fix.

entry.title: Nielsen number is a knot invariant
entry.summary: We show that the Nielsen number of a map is a knot invariant via representation variety
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, accepted in Banach Center Publications

entry.title: Almost complex 4-manifolds with vanishing first Chern class
entry.summary: An odd Seiberg-Witten invariant imposes bounds on the signature of a closed, almost complex 4-manifold with vanishing first Chern class. This applies in particular to symplectic 4-manifolds of Kodaira dimension zero.

entry.title: Meridional surfaces and (1,1)-knots
entry.summary: We determine all (1,1)-knots which admit an essential meridional surface, namely, we give a construction which produces (1,1)-knots having essential meridional surfaces, and show that if a (1,1)-knot admits an essential meridional surface then it comes from the given construction.

entry.title: On embedding infinite cyclic covers in compact 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We show that the infinite cyclic cover of the exterior of the untwisted Whitehead double of a non-trivial knot does not embed in any compact 3-manifold, answering a question of Jiang, Ni, Wang and Zhou.

entry.title: Crosscap Numbers of Two-component Links
entry.summary: We define the crosscap number of a 2-component link as the minimum of the first Betti numbers of connected, non-orientable surfaces bounding the link. We discuss some properties of the crosscap numbers of 2-component links.

entry.title: Families of knots for which Morton's inequality is strict
entry.summary: We describe a procedure for creating infinite families of knots, each having the maximum degree of their HOMFLY polynomial strictly less than twice their canonical genus. These families build upon examples first found by Stoimenow.

entry.title: Canonical genus and the Whitehead doubles of pretzel knots
entry.summary: We show that for an alternating pretzel knot K the canonical genera of its Whitehead doubles W(K) are equal to the crossing number c(K) of K, verifying a conjecture of Tripp in the case of these knots.

entry.title: Tangent bundle and Gauss functor of a combinatorial manifold
entry.summary: Pure combinatorial models for BPL_n and Gauss map of a combinatorial manifold are described.

entry.title: Reducible and toroidal Dehn fillings with distance 3
entry.summary: If a simple 3-manifold M admits a reducible and a toroidal Dehn filling, the distance between the filling slopes is known to be bounded by three. In this paper, we classify all manifolds which admit a reducible Dehn filling and a toroidal Dehn filling with distance 3.

entry.title: Uniqueness of bridge surfaces for 2-bridge knots
entry.summary: Any 2-bridge knot in the 3-sphere has a bridge sphere from which any other bridge surface can be obtained by stabilization, meridional stabilization, perturbation and proper isotopy.

entry.title: Boundaries of right-angled hyperbolic buildings
entry.summary: We prove that the boundary of a right-angled hyperbolic building is a universal Menger space. Corollary: the 3-dimensional universal Menger space is the boundary of some Gromov-hyperbolic group.

entry.title: Virtual Manifolds and Localization
entry.summary: In this paper, we explore the virtual technique that is very useful in studying moduli problem from differential geometric point of view. We introduce a class of new objects "virtual manifolds/orbifolds", on which we develop the integration theory. In particular, the virtual localization formula is obtained.

entry.title: No embeddings of solenoids into surfaces
entry.summary: A quick proof of Bing's theorem indicated by the title is given. The proof also concludes Gumerov's result on covering degrees of solenoids.

entry.title: The classification of Toroidal Dehn surgeries on Montesinos knots
entry.summary: Exceptional Dehn surgeries have been classified for 2-bridge knots and Montesinos knots of length at least 4. In this paper we classify all toroidal Dehn surgeries on Montesinos knots of length 3.

entry.title: Construction of Exotic Smooth Structures
entry.summary: In this article, we construct infinitley many simply connected, nonsymplectic and pairwise nondiffeomorphic 4-manifolds starting from E(n) and applying the sequence of knot surgery, ordinary blowups and rational blowdown. We also compute the Seiberg-Witten invariants of these manifolds.

entry.title: Heegaard splittings of Seifert manifolds without an orientable base space
entry.summary: We use Heath's, Moriah's and Schultens's results to prove that irreducible Heegaard splittings of orientable Seifert manifolds with nonorientable base space are either vertical or horizontal.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, 3 figures. Removed section about I-bundles as results had already been published

entry.title: Finiteness of arithmetic hyperbolic reflection groups
entry.summary: We prove that there are only finitely many conjugacy classes of arithmetic maximal hyperbolic reflection groups.

entry.title: A Note on Y-energies of Knots
entry.summary: We study a 1-form which can be given by a vector in a conformally invariant way. We then study conformally invariant functionals associated to a ``Y-diagram'' on the space of knots which are made from the 1-form.

entry.title: New lower bound for the distortion of a knotted curve
entry.summary: We prove that distortion of a knotted curve in $\R^3$ is great than 4.76. This improves a result obtained by John M. Sullivan and Elizabeth Denne in \cite{DS}.

entry.title: On the 3-Dimensional Poincaré Conjecture and the 4-Dimensional Smooth Schoenflies Problem
entry.summary: This is the announcement of an alternative approach to the 3-dimensional Poincar\'e Conjecture, different from Perelman's big and spectacular breakthrough. No claim concerning the other parts of the Thurston Geometrization Conjecture, come with our purely 4-dimensional line of argument.

entry.title: Intersection homology of stratified fibrations and neighborhoods
entry.summary: We derive spectral sequences for the intersection homology of stratified fibrations and approximate tubular neighborhoods in manifold stratified spaces. These neighborhoods include regular neighborhoods in PL stratified spaces.

entry.title: On computational aspects of two classical knot invariants
entry.summary: We look into computational aspects of two classical knot invariants. We look for ways of simplifying the computation of the coloring invariant and of the Alexander module. We support our ideas with explicit computations on pretzel knots.

entry.title: Topological complexity of generic hyperplane arrangements
entry.summary: We prove that the topological complexity of (a motion planning algorithm on) the complement of generic complex essential hyperplane arrangement of $n$ hyperplanes in an $r$-dimensional linear space is min$\{n+1,2r\}$.

entry.title: A symplectic manifold homeomorphic but not diffeomorphic to CP^2 # 3(-CP^2)
entry.summary: In this paper we construct a minimal symplectic 4-manifold and prove it is homeomorphic but not diffeomorphic to CP^2 # 3(-CP^2)

entry.title: Khovanov-Rozansky Graph Homology and Composition Product
entry.summary: In analogy with a recursive formula for the HOMFLY-PT polynomial of links given by Jaeger, we give a recursive formula for the graph polynomial introduced by Kauffman and Vogel. We show how this formula extends to the Khovanov-Rozansky graph homology.

entry.title: Geometric descriptions of polygon and chain spaces
entry.summary: We give a few simple methods to geometically describe some polygon and chain-spaces in R^d. They are strong enough to give tables of m-gons and m-chains when m <= 6.

entry.title: Geometric limits of quasi-Fuchsian groups
entry.summary: In this paper, we will determine the topological types of hyperbolic 3-anifolds H^3/G such that G is a geometric limit of any algebraically convergent sequence of quasi-Fuchsian groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is a simplified and cleared version of already circulated ones

entry.title: Closed incompressible surfaces of genus two in 3-bridge knot complements
entry.summary: In this paper, we characterize closed incompressible surfaces of genus two in the complements of 3-bridge knots and links. This characterization includes that of essential 2-string tangle decompositions for 3-bridge knots and links.

entry.title: A note on circle patterns on surfaces
entry.summary: In this paper we give two different proofs of Bobenko and Springborn's theorem of circle pattern: there exists a hyperbolic (or Euclidean) circle pattern with proscribed intersection angles and cone angles on a cellular decomposed surface up to isometry (or similarity).

entry.title: Tangle embeddings and quandle cocycle invariants
entry.summary: To study embeddings of tangles in knots, we use quandle cocycle invariants. Computations are carried out for the tables of knots and tangles, to investigate which tangles may or may not embed in knots in the tables.

entry.title: The Witten-Reshetikhin-Turaev Invariants of Lens Spaces
entry.summary: We derive an explicit formula for the Witten-Reshetikhin-Turaev SO(3)-invariants of lens spaces. We use the representation of the mapping class group of the torus corresponding to the Witten-Reshetikhin-Turaev SO(3)-TQFT to give such formula.

entry.title: Billiards in L-shaped tables with barriers
entry.summary: We compute the volumes of the eigenform loci in the moduli space of genus two Abelian differentials. From this, we obtain asymptotic formulas for counting closed billiards paths in certain L-shaped polygons with barriers.

entry.title: Hyperbolic knots with three toroidal Dehn surgeries
entry.summary: It is conjectured that a hyperbolic knot admits at most three Dehn surgeries which yield closed three manifolds containing incompressible tori. We show that there exist infinitely many hyperbolic knots which attain the conjectural maximum number. Interestingly, those surgeries correspond to consecutive integers.

entry.title: A cube of resolutions for knot Floer homology
entry.summary: We develop a skein exact sequence for knot Floer homology, involving singular knots. This leads to an explicit, algebraic description of knot Floer homology in terms of a braid projection of the knot.

entry.title: On the principal ideal theorem in arithmetic topology
entry.summary: In this paper we state and prove the analogous of the principal ideal theorem of algebraic number theory for the case of 3-manifolds from the point of view of arithmetic topology.

entry.title: Stabilizing the monodromy of an open book decomposition
entry.summary: We prove that any mapping class on a compact oriented surface with nonempty boundary can be made pseudo-Anosov and right-veering after a sequence of positive stabilizations.

entry.title: A method to find ideal points from ideal triangulations
entry.summary: We give a simple method to find ideal points of the character variety of a 3-manifold from an ideal triangulation.

entry.title: The vanishing of the contact invariant in the presence of torsion
entry.summary: We prove that the Ozsvath-Szabo contact invariant of a closed contact 3-manifold with positive Giroux torsion vanishes.

entry.title: A refinement of Khovanov-Rozansky link homology
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an error in the proof of Theorem 1.

entry.title: Generating mapping class groups of nonorientable surfaces with boundary
entry.summary: We obtain simple generating sets for various mapping class groups of a nonorientable surface with punctures and/or boundary. We also compute the abelianizations of these mapping class groups.

entry.title: On tight contact structures with negative maximal twisting number on small Seifert manifolds
entry.summary: We study some properties of transverse contact structures on small Seifert manifolds, and we apply them to the classification of tight contact structures on a family of small Seifert manifolds.

entry.title: Normal Surface Theory in Link Diagrams
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due to a significant error in section 4.3.1.

entry.title: Lower bounds for the volume of hyperbolic $n$-orbifolds
entry.summary: In this paper an explicit formula for a lower bound on the volume of a hyperbolic orbifold, dependent on dimension and the maximal order of torsion in the orbifolds' fundamental group, is constructed.

entry.title: On rational blow-downs in Heegaard-Floer homology
entry.summary: Motivated by a result of L.P. Roberts on rational blow-downs in Heegaard-Floer homology, we study such operations along 3-manifolds that arise as branched double covers of $S^{3}$ along several non-alternating, slice knots.

entry.title: Order one invariants of spherical curves
entry.summary: We give a complete description of all order 1 invariants of spherical curves. We also identify the subspaces of all J-invariants and S-invariants, and present two equalities satisfied by any spherical curve.

entry.title: Lens space surgeries and L-space homology spheres
entry.summary: We describe necessary and sufficient conditions for a knot in an L-space to have an L-space homology sphere surgery. We use these conditions to reformulate a conjecture of Berge about which knots in S^3 admit lens space surgeries.

entry.title: Reducible And Finite Dehn Fillings
entry.summary: We show that the distance between a finite filling slope and a reducible filling slope on the boundary of a hyperbolic knot manifold is at most one.

entry.title: The Weight System of the Multivariable Alexander Polynomial
entry.summary: We derive a formula for the weight system of the multivariable Alexander polynomial using determinants, show that it obeys known relations, and satisfies some of the same relations as the single variable polynomial.

entry.title: On fields of definition of arithmetic Kleinian reflection groups
entry.summary: We show that degrees of the real fields of definition of arithmetic Kleinian reflection groups are bounded by 35.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, to appear in Proc. Amer. Math. Soc

entry.title: Geometric approach towards stable homotopy groups of spheres. Kervaire Invariant
entry.summary: It is proved that there exists an integer $L$ such that a framed manifold of dimension $2^l-2$, $l\le L$ has the trivial Kervaire Invariant.

entry.title: Unknot diagrams requiring a quadratic number of Reidemeister moves to untangle
entry.summary: We present a sequence of diagrams of the unknot for which the minimum number of Reidemeister moves required to pass to the trivial diagram is quadratic with respect to the number of crossings. These bounds apply both in $S^2$ and in $\R^2$.

entry.title: Least Area Planes in Hyperbolic 3-Space are Properly Embedded
entry.summary: We show that if P is an embedded least area (area minimizing) plane in hyperbolic 3-space whose asymptotic boundary is a simple closed curve with at least one smooth point, then P is properly embedded.

entry.title: Lens space surgeries & primitive/Seifert type constructions
entry.summary: We show that lens space surgeries on knots in $S^3$ which arise from the primitive/Seifert type construction also arise from the primitive/primitive construction. This is the first step of a three step program to prove the Berge conjecture for tunnel number one knots.

entry.title: On the realizations of high dimensional solenoids as attractors and as non-wondering sets
entry.summary: This paper will be splited into two papers and submited later.

entry.title: A Note on Overtwisted Contact Structures
entry.summary: In this note, we use the recent work of Honda-Kazez-Matic [HKM] to prove that a closed contact 3-manifold admitting a compatible open book decomposition with a nontrivial monodromy which can be presented as a product of left handed Dehn twists is overtwisted.
